dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN, mid 20’s, enters the room, revealing a breath-ta view of Toronto -- specifically the CN Tower -- the world tallest free-standing structure. When she enters the bedroom suite, she starts feeling diz nauseous, and begins losing her balance. The room becomes blurry, and she kneels to the ground, holding her stomach She writhes on the floor for a moment, COUGHING, before crawling towards the phone. As she slides against the side of the bed, reaching for t phone, someone’s hand GRABS her wrist... and gently pulls away. Two MEN IN GAS-MASKS stand over her. One of them, VICTOR KOZLOW, 30’s, kneels over her, as she GASPS for air. His comrade, BECKER, 30's, searches through her suitcase. Kozlow holds up a small plastic gas-mask, and places it o her nose and mouth. She begins breathing much easier. Kozlow calmly SPEAKS with a Ukrainian accent.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: Where... is the Locust? The woman’s breaths turn into a slight LAUGH. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Beyond your reach.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: So, you do know where the Locust is? The woman nods.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then where is he?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: (smiles) Beyond your reach... Kozlow removes the mask, causing the Woman to GASP for ai again. He watches her, as she begins to tremble.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: Your room is poisoned with Chlorine gas. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you're feeling right now, is your nervous system deteriorating. If you answer my question correctly, you can keep the mask. If not, I will keep the mask. Do you understand? The woman nods again. Kozlow places the mask back on her face.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, I‘’1l ask you one more time...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: And in that one time... you’1ll get the same answer. The woman RIPS the mask off, and tosses it under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: Stupid girl. She SPITS on Kozlow, who SLAPS her back.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER
dialogues.text: (in Ukrainian) I found it! Becker finds a gray folder in her suitcase, and brings it over to Kozlow. Kozlow opens the folder and scans the content. Valuable information is inside. Meanwhile, the Toronto POLICE arrive down below -- SIRENS blaring.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Ukrainian) Let’s go! Come on! Kozlow looks back at the woman, as she slowly dies in fro of him.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s no time! Kozlow stares at the woman, as tears stream down her face Finally... she takes her last breath... Kozlow checks her pulse -- she’s dead. Kozlow rises, grabs the gray folder, and exits the room w Becker. They both turn to SLOW MOTION as the opening riff “American Woman” begins. CLOSE UP: The Woman’s face, eyes open, dead to the world.  When the song KICKS in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “American Woman” continues on the radio, as three TEENAGE drive down the highway. GILLY, 18, (male) longish hair, drives while JAKE, 17, heavy set, sits in the passenger s NATHAN HARPER, 18, tee-shirt-and-jeans type, sits in the seat, looking out the window. Jake and Gilly are LAUGHING as they pass a joint around t car. When they offer it to Nathan, he passes. Gilly SINGS along with the song, while Nathan and Jake LA at him. They pass a road sign which reads: Bridgewater, Virginia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their car pulls into a large PARTY scene outside someone’ house. MUSIC blasts from outdoor speakers, as Nathan, Gil and Jake get out of their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan, Gilly and Jake squeeze through the CROWD, looking the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: Yo, Nathan. Paintball tomorrow, man. Free rentals, free everything.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Nah. Gunning down people is not my idea of a good time. Gilly approaches two JOCKS, 18, with their football jacke on.

dialogues.speaker: JOCK 1
dialogues.text: You got the goods? Gilly takes out two fake Virginia IDs, with both of the jocks’ pictures on them.  Jock 2 grabs his ID and looks it over -- he’s impressed.

dialogues.speaker: JOCK 2
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: Fifty each. The Jocks shell out the cash, and hand it over.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Welcome to your twenties. Suddenly, Nathan accidentally BUMPS into KAREN LOWELL, 18 gorgeous brunette. They look at each other, as she tries get by him.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (awkwardly) Hi. Karen's boyfriend, BILLY WILKINSON, 19, slightly pushes Nathan out of the way, so he and Karen can get by. Karen LAUGHS a little at Nathan and then disappears into CROWD with Billy.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: Ultra bitch, dude. Don’t even sweat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan, Gilly and Jake do shots. Nathan holds up a beer to make a toast.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Guys, I love you. You’re my best friends. This is to our last month of high school. May it be drunken and debaucherous.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY AND JAKE
dialogues.text: Cheers! They tap and drink.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: And promise me... Promise me, if I get wasted tonight, that you won’t leave me on the front lawn again. I seriously don’t know whose house this is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers! They tap and drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan lies face down on the front lawn, passed out, hold a plastic cup with beer. A teenage GIRL walks by Nathan with a garbage bag and tak the cup out of his hand. She lightly KICKS him, to wake h up. Nathan slowly raises his head, with a line of drool comin out. He squints up at the girl in the sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Wake up, whoever you are, my parents are gonna be here in an hour. You gotta get out of here. As she walks away, Nathan looks around. He has no idea wh he is.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: CREDITS END
dialogues.text: INT. NATHAN’S CAR -- LATE MORNING Nathan’s dad, KEVIN HARPER, 40’s, drives the car, while Nathan sits in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Nathan... under the description for ‘dad’, does it say he has to pick up his drunken son from random people’s front lawns, as a general rule? Because this is the third time this year.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Please don’t tell mom.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Mom already knows. Nathan hangs his head down.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: It’s not my fault they keep leaving me on the front lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s your fault you keep trusting them to bring you home.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: They're having a laugh at your expense. Which is all fine and good. But trust needs to be earned.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Like, I trust you’11 tell mom I wasn’t drinking? Kevin LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Not gonna happen. You’re on your own, kiddo.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Don’t you have any power in our household?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (beat) Nope. Nathan looks at his father in discouragement.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Do you know these people, who live in your house, and cook your dinners and fold your underwear? Because I sure don’t. INT. DR. BENNETT’S OFFICE -- AFTERNOON Dr. Bennett, 50, glasses, sits across from Nathan, listen to him explain his plight.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: They look like you, they talk like you... but they’re not really on your team, you know? It’s like it’s you against them.

dialogues.speaker: DR. BENNETT
dialogues.text: I think everyone feels that way growing up.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Does everyone go to a shrink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not everyone has insomnia, or anxiety attacks, at your age. Sometimes it just helps to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: What else is there to talk about? It’s all been said before.

dialogues.speaker: DR. BENNETT
dialogues.text: The nightmare. The recurring one. You said there was something different about it this time.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: There was... Dr. Bennett presses “record” on a mini-CD player, placed the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s the same as always. A woman, standing in the shadows, is singing me a lullaby. While she’s singing it to me, a single tear drops from her eyes and falls onto my arm. And then she backs away from me, and disappears. Leaving me alone in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: DR. BENNETT
dialogues.text: So, what’s the difference between this nightmare and the rest?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: The difference is, it wasn’t a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: DR. BENNETT
dialogues.text: Because it didn’t scare you?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Because I wasn’t asleep. It’s just something that popped into my head the other day, like a memory.

dialogues.speaker: DR. BENNETT
dialogues.text: Well, maybe you just remember dreaming it.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Or maybe it was never a dream. Because there isn’t a day that goes by, when I don’t wake up and check my arm for that teardrop.  INT. NATHAN’S BEDROOM -- NIGHT Nathan listens to loud PUNK MUSIC, while doing his homewo His mother MARA HARPER, 40’s, enters the room. She turns his iPod stereo, and sits on his bed. Nathan looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: It’s not the drinking that bothers me. I was a teenager once, too. I absolutely get it. But it’s becoming too much of a regular thing.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: So, you're not grounding me?

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: You’re grounded for the weekend.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: How about just until tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Saturday?

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Saturday, and I’1ll patch up the roof, so you don’t have to yell at dad to do it, anymore.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Deal. Mara gets up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (smiles) I love you mom.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Uh huh... Try to get some sleep tonight, for once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan and Gilly open their prospective lockers. As Natha takes out his books, he notices Gilly’s locker is filled an array of pictures of rifles and automatic weapons.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: The Maritime kidnapper. Another kid disappeared just two towns over. I’m thinking about getting some protection.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: The Maritime kidnapper abducts kindergartners and infants. You might be just a little outside his demographic.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: You can never be too sure. (motioning to a particular firearm) Check this out -- M82 automatic sniper rifle. Shoots a ten round clip in under a minute. My dad has this exact gun up in his den. You could wipe out an entire neighborhood with it.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I think maybe you have a problem. Nathan diverts his attention to Karen Lowell, standing ac the hallway. She’s CONVERSING with her CHEERLEADER FRIEND at her locker. Gilly notices Nathan staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: She's your next door neighbor now, dude.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Yup, three weeks. Hasn’t said “hi” to me once.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: Man, I'd be checking out her bedroom window, constantly.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: That’s what scares me about you.  10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. MILES, 50’s, glasses, dry humor, is in session with 3 High School STUDENTS. The chalkboard behind him reads: Sociology. Nathan, Gilly, Jake and Karen are all in attendance, as M Miles SPEAKS.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MILES
dialogues.text: Well, I’m sure you’ve all heard about the Maritime kidnapper. He struck again last night. Fifth child in less than three months. Mr. Miles removes a Playboy magazine from inside Jake’s o textbook.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m considering having you all write an essay on him, if you don’t get your grades up soon. Mr. Miles SLAPS a ruler on a SLEEPING STUDENT’S desk, awakening him.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You_may think this class is a bullshit elective, people, but it goes on your report card, all the same. All I’m asking for is to raise you average class grade above a ‘C’. In case you don’t remember... a ‘C’ is a fairly low, shitty grade. It shouldn’t be too hard to rise above it. SNORING can be heard from the back of the room.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Somehow, I’m sure you’re gonna screw this up. Nathan also starts dozing off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan lies in bed, while a SHADOWED WOMAN sits next to h As the rain outside POUNDS against the window, the woman SINGS to Nathan in a kind, but eerie way.  11.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOWED WOMAN
dialogues.text: (echo-y) Que Sera, Sera, Whatever will be, will be The future's not ours, to see Que Sera, Sera What will be, will be. Nathan reaches out to touch her face, but his hand goes r through her. She's a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: END OF DREAM
dialogues.text: INT. NATHAN’S BEDROOM -- EARLY MORNING Nathan wakes up in a sweat. He looks disheveled -- wipes his eyes. He cracks open a prescription bottle and swallows a couple pills. A car can be heard PULLING up next door. Nathan goes to the window, and sees Karen Lowell, getting of the car and ARGUING with her boyfriend, BILLY, in the driveway. Eventually, Billy DRIVES off, in a huff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan adjusts some new shingles on the roof, with his iP headphones on, listens to PUNK MUSIC. The sun shines bright, and the roof tar is sticky. Nathan SINGS along to the Sex Pistols “Anarchy in the UK”

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (chanting) “How many ways To get what you want? I use the best, I use the rest I use the enemy, I use anarchy” INT. KAREN’S BEDROOM -- SIMULTANEOUS Karen and her GIRLFRIENDS are hanging up clothes in her closet. They overhear Nathan SINGING next door. They go to her window, and see Nathan moving his head bac and forth, SINGING along to the song. They start LAUGHING

dialogues.speaker: GIRLFRIEND 1
dialogues.text: What a weirdo.  12.

dialogues.speaker: GIRLFRIEND 2
dialogues.text: I heard he sees a shrink. Total nutball. Karen grabs her iPhone and aims it at Nathan -- hits RECO

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (chanting) “Or just another country Another council tenancy” Nathan loves the song -- gets more into it.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (chanting) “And I wanna be anarchy. And I wanna be anarchy” Finally, he turns his head towards Karen’s house. NATHAN’S POV: Karen and her friends, LAUGHING at him. Nathan doesn’t really mind -- half smiles back at Karen. Suddenly, a shingle SLIPS from underneath his foot, and h loses his grasp, ripping off two more shingles. He SLIDES down the roof, and FLIPS over the side of the house, bare catching the gutter. Dangling from the gutter, Nathan desperately tries to rea for the roof’s edge, but the gutter BENDS back and SNAPS half, causing Nathan to FALL twenty feet into the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: BAM
dialogues.text: INT. KAREN’S BEDROOM -- SIMULTANEOUS Karen and her friends are LAUGHING HYSTERICALLY. They can barely catch their breath. EXT. NATHAN’S BUSHES -- SIMULTANEOUS Nathan lies in the bushes, listening to Karen and her girlfriends LAUGHING next door. He lifts up his iPod -- i broken.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Great...  13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nathan walks through the hallway towards his locker, h notices other STUDENTS looking at him weird -- WHISPERING GIGGLING, and parting ways as he walks by. When he reaches his locker, Gilly is grabbing his textboo from the adjacent locker. Gilly also looks at Nathan strangely.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: You mean, you don’t know?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Know what?

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: Dude... You’re a YouTube sensation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan enters the Tech room -- some FRESHMEN are watching YouTube video of him at one of the computers. They stop LAUGHING when they notice him, standing right behind them They back off so he can watch the video. ON THE COMPUTER SCREEN: Nathan, SINGING Cheap Trick, FALLING, catching and BREAKING the gutter, and PLUNGING i the bushes. Nathan quickly grabs the mouse and scrolls the page: 156,000 hits He finds the Poster: K_Grrr11991 He CLICKS the Username. The profile page reads: Karen Lowell Nathan SLAMS the mouse on the desk and storms out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan barges into a packed gym class, walking directly towards Karen Lowell, who’s GIGGLING with her five GIRLFRIENDS. The whole CLASS parts like the Red Sea when Nathan approa Karen. Everyone turns silent as he looks straight at Kare dead in the eyes.  14.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Must be nice to be the toast of the day, but I guess that’s nothing new for you. You’re a popular girl, and you play the role well. Complete with the obedient cronies and the college boyfriend. But in the end, it’s just a role.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: You don’t know anything about me.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Seventh grade, Science class. We were lab partners. You told me you wanted to be an archeologist. You were cool. What ever happened to that girl? Traded it in for a pair of pom-poms?

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: I take it you can’t take a joke?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I may have looked like an idiot falling into those bushes, but at least I know who I am.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Really? Is that what your therapist tells you? SNICKERING can be heard, as Nathan tries to stay calm.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I guess it’s hard to keep secrets in a small town. But I won’t be here for long. How ‘bout you? Community College? Summer job at the Gap? I’1l1 be sure to drop by in three years when they promote you to Manager.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Who cares if you leave this town, or not? It’s not like anyone would remember you, anyway. Nathan’s genuinely hurt by this comment. Karen immediatel regrets saying it. Nathan looks around -- EVERYONE staring at him. A profoun feeling of alienation sets in. Finally, he walks away, leaving the room in stunned silen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Miles, WRITES a large /D’ on the chalkboard, under average class grade. Nathan looks out the window as Mr. Miles SPEAKS. Karen looks sullen.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MILES
dialogues.text: Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to write a four page essay on the subject of missing children. Percentage of disappearance rate, how often they’re found, under what circumstances. Etc. Etc. The room GROANS. ERNESTO, 17, raises his hand. MR. MILES (CONT’D) Yes, Ernesto?

dialogues.speaker: ERNESTO
dialogues.text: (smiles) What if we choose not to accept it?

dialogues.speaker: MR. MILES
dialogues.text: Then you get a big, fat stinky ‘F’, mi amigo. On the semester. And remember, people, Wikipedia is not your friend. I want the cold, hard facts on this one. And I want them by Friday. The room GROANS more.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know, I know. Your lives are destroyed forever. But to lessen the workload, I’m going to let each of you partner up with someone on this one, and then you can share the responsibility, as well as the grade. Fair enough? The bell RINGS. Everyone starts to gather their textbooks

dialogues.speaker: MR. MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I also want one page dedicated to a specific incident of a missing child in the United States, within the past thirty years. NOT the Maritime kidnapper. (beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MR. MILES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If anyone wants to donate an apple or a candy bar to me, you may do so at this time. EXT. HALLWAY / KAREN’S LOCKER -- MOMENTS LATER Karen, not talkative, removes her textbooks from her lock while her GIRLFRIENDS JABBER.

dialogues.speaker: GIRLFRIEND 1
dialogues.text: I was like, yeah, I listened to that band, like, two years ago. Where have you been? The other girls LAUGH, and COMMENT, as Karen looks across hall at Nathan... He looks lonely, as he gathers his thin Karen ignores her friends’ snobby BANTER, and walks towar Nathan. INT. HALLWAY / NATHAN’S LOCKER -- CONTINUOUS Nathan switches out his text books, while Karen cautiousl approaches him. He ignores her presence.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: So... wanna be my partner?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I’d rather be castrated.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Look, I’m sorry, okay? I shouldn’t have put it up. It was funny, and now it’s not funny.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I’m sure this is some ploy to get me to do your homework for you.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: I’m not vindictive. I already feel bad enough about this whole thing, as it is.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I’m late for class. Nathan CLOSES his locker.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Who are you going to take? Gilly? Jake? They’re worse than me. Nathan walks away.  17. INT. NATHAN’S BEDROOM -- DUSK Nathan PLAYS Halo on his X-Box. His cell phone RINGS. He blindly picks up, still playing the game as he talks.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: phone) I'll do the first three pages. You just do the ‘specific incident’ part.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (phone) I took the video down. Erased it entirely.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Congratulations. You want a medal?

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (phone) Do we have a deal?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Nope. Nathan HANGS up. Suddenly, the door bell RINGS. Nathan looks out his windo Karen is at his front door. Nathan’s Halo character BLOWS from a bomb, because of Nathan’s lack of attention. Nathan watches his mother let Karen into the house.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Holy shit. He quickly grabs his clothes off the floor, and shoves th into his hamper. He slides a bunch of stuff under his bed and glances at himself in the mirror -- fixes his hair. As Karen KNOCKS outside his door, he dives back into his seat.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come in. Karen enters the room and looks around. She sees the wall lined with books, movies, and computer software. An entir area of the room is filled with board games, chess sets, computer games.  18.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: You like games, huh?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Not the kind of games you play. Karen SHUTS the door behind her -- walks right up to Nath

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: (stern) Now you listen to me. I screwed up, okay? But I’m not going to sit back and watch you mope and groan and give me dirty looks for the rest of the summer. Maybe a lot of things you said about me were true. I don’t know who I want to be just yet. But while I’m figuring that out, I’d very much like for us to be friends. And if you keep rejecting my peaceful gestures, I'll kick the ever-loving shit out of you. Capiche? Nathan slowly nods, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (putting out her hand) Partners? Nathan shakes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good. Glad we cleared that up. Now where do we start? INT. NATHAN’S BEDROOM -- LATER THAT NIGHT Nathan and Karen are doing research on their separate laptops. Karen cross-checks a fact with a book called “America’s Missing”.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Listen to this. Over twenty three hundred Americans are reported missing every day. And even though most of them voluntarily return home, there are still over one hundred thousand active missing person cases today. One hundred thousand... sick. Nathan surfs through some pictures of missing people on t web.  19.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: What’s even more sick, is some of these sites want me to pay money to browse their missing persons archives.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: That’s fucked up. Karen gets up to watch Nathan find a back door into the website.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Twenty bucks to access Montana’s missing persons database... no wonder nobody gets found. Suddenly, he breaks through their security.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bingo. A long list of names quickly scrolls across his computer screen. The information seems endless.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Whoa...

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Wow. Height, weight, age, favorite food, medical reports, last place they were seen, people they were affiliated with. Everything.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Well, Nathan Harper, you have a few tricks up your sleeve, huh?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (browsing the pages) Some. Karen checks her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Shit, I gotta go. Be back tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Cool. Karen grabs her laptop and books and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, um... I’m sorry about everything I said, earlier. I didn’t mean it. I was just angry.  20.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Really? So you don’t think I’11 make manager in three years? Nathan cracks a smile.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See ya tomorrow. Karen leaves.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENT LATER
dialogues.text: Nathan looks out the window at Karen returning to her hou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen walks with her GIRLFRIENDS on the lunch line. When pays for her meal, she sees Nathan, sitting by himself at of the tables. STUDENTS won’t go near him after his YouTube notoriety. Karen looks over at the table she usually sits at -- JOCK and EMO KIDS. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: It’s my fault he’s sitting by himself...

dialogues.speaker: GIRLFRIEND 1
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: GIRLFRIEND 2
dialogues.text: The psycho? NATHAN’S TABLE -- MOMENTS LATER Karen sits down across from Nathan -- starts eating her f like it’s no big deal. Nathan looks around at people in the cafeteria. Everyone’ looking at them -- some overtly and some just glancing. Nathan turns back to Karen, impressed. They smile at each other as if they have an inside joke. INT. NATHAN’S BEDROOM -- DUSK Karen works at Nathan’s desktop, while Nathan lies on his bed, researching some books.  21.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Check this out. This site shows you mock-ups of what they might look like today. And if you recognize the person, you can click to see their childhood pics. Nathan gets up from the bed, interested.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: They should all do that. Karen scrolls through some mock-ups -- all computer renderings of the missing children. She comes across some amusing ones.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Check out this guy.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Sylvester Stallone meets... Pee Wee Herman.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: (laughing) Seriously! Next. Karen scrolls to the next mock-up.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Yikes... Ryan Seacrest meets...

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Liza Minelli. They both LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Next. The next mock-up reveals a teenager who looks a lot like Nathan. KAREN (CONT’D) Chris Martin meets... you. Nathan smiles -- there’s a strong resemblance, but not identical.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I guess I’m a fugitive from justice. Karen CLICKS on the childhood photo -- a young boy, three years old, white Caucasian, wearing a yellow-and-blue str shirt.  22.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s definitely not you. This kid’s too cute. Nathan takes pause at the young boy’s photo. He smiles al with the joke, but this boy seems eerily familiar...

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I used to have a shirt just like that... Karen’s cell phone BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Shit, it’s my mom. They’re leaving town for a few days. I get the house to myself. I gotta go see them off. You coming over later?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll be over there in an hour, cool?

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Awesome. Karen runs out of the room. As Nathan closes the door, he looks at the small boy pict on his screen. It’s almost like the boy is looking back a him. He sits at his desktop, and grabs the mouse -- reads the page. The boy’s name is Steven Spade. He stares at the image for a moment, before zooming in on SCREEN CLOSE UP: The boy has a small scar on the left sid of his chin. Nathan has the identical scar on his chin -- he rubs his finger over it. He CLICKS back to the mock-up of what the young boy would look like now. As the picture loads in, Nathan sees his reflection in the computer screen side by side with the m up... it’s a very close resemblance. Nathan rolls back from the computer in his chair. Spooked

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan digs through an old chest in the attic. He rummages through the old toys and school drawings, as parents are PULLING into the driveway down below.  23. He looks out the window at them as they get out of their and take some groceries from the trunk. He continues digging through the chest until he gets to s of his old clothes. At the very bottom of the pile, tucked in the deepest, darkest corner of the chest, is a striped yellow and blue shirt. He slowly unfolds it -- it’s exactly like the shir in the picture. He hears his parents GETTING IN downstairs and rushes out the attic. INT. NATHAN’S BEDROOM -- MOMENTS LATER Nathan hears his parents turn on the TV downstairs, while sits at this computer, trying to obtain more information. Name: Steven Spade Parents: Martin and Lorna Spade Date of disappearance: December 20th, 1994 Last seen: Sterling Forest, New York. 2:30PM Notable attributes: Scar on chin He PRINTS the picture of the boy and the mock-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan descends the stairs, quietly. He peers into the Living Room -- his parents are watching reality televisio He opens the front door slowly, and sneaks out. INT. NATHAN’S CAR -- NIGHT Nathan gets in his car and STARTS the engine. He places t printout of the young child on the passenger seat. A TAP at the window STARTLES him. It’s his mother. He quickly turns the printout over. Mara looks at the sheet of paper and then back at Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: No ‘hello mom’?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Sorry, I uh... was just going to go to the library for this school project...  24.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: What’s the project?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: It's a... project on... websites. Building your own website. Nathan tries to gage his mother’s reaction. Mara nods and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Well, don’t stay out too late, okay? Love you. Mara goes to kiss Nathan on the forehead, but he balks -- subtly pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: MARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You all right? Nathan nods, and backs out of the driveway. As he drives away, Mara just watches him, until he disapp down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a dimly lit basement, with books and computer software lining the walls, an OLDER MAN, 60, TYPES on his computer We never see his face. ON THE COMPUTER SCREEN: A profile page on Nathan Harper - including his high school picture, school grades, medical reports, etc. The Older Man has photos on his desk of Nathan’s parents, Bennett, Gilly -- everyone he has contact with. The room is filled with technical equipment, tracking software, high-tech phone-tapping gadgets, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan scans through microfilm of New York newspapers fro the early nineties. He finally reaches December, 1994. - He searches ‘The Record’ -- nothing. - He searches ‘The Orange County Patriot’ -- nothing. - He searches ‘The Times Herald Record’ -- nothing. His cell phone VIBRATES. It’s a text from Karen:  25. thnx for standing me up Nathan immediately CALLS her back. It RINGS for a while before she picks up.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (whispers on phone) Listen to me. I did some research on-

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You’re such an asshole you know that? I cooked up a couple TV dinners and then waited for you for two hours. I’m so stupid-

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (phone) Will you let me speak for a sec-

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You can find someone else to do the project with-

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (phone) Will you shut up for a second, and listen to me? I think the missing kid we saw on that website is more than just a resemblance. Silence. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (phone) I think the kid in that picture... is me. INT. KAREN’S BEDROOM -- LATER THAT NIGHT Karen sits at her laptop reading the web page, while Nath paces around behind her.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: On December 20th, 1994, Steven Spade went missing, while on vacation, at the Sterling Forest State Park sometime between 2:15 and 2:30PM. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His parents immediately received ransom threats for the safe return of their child. After following the abductor’s instructions, and paying out more than four hundred thousand dollars within a six day period, the abductor cut off contact, and Steven was never returned to his family. The case remains one of Connecticut's greatest unsolved mysteries to date. Nathan leans against the window, biting his nails.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nathan, I really don’t think this is you.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Okay, good. Tell me why.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Well, first of all, this kid’s three and a half years old. Don’t we all look the same at that age?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: We have the same scar.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Coincidence. Nathan grabs the shirt out of his backpack and tosses it her.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Explain this. Karen cross-checks the shirt with the photo.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Okay, it’s a similar shirt.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: No, not the shirt. The ketchup stain on the left shoulder. Karen examines the stain on the shirt she holds. zooms into the online picture... the same exact stain exi on the left shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Holy shit... Karen slowly turns and looks at Nathan.  27.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe... you were adopted.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: If I was adopted, then why would I be on a missing persons website? Karen looks back at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: A better question would be... who are the people living in your house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan eats dinner with his parents. Only the sounds of EATING can be heard, as Kevin reads the newspaper, and Ma reads a romance novel. Nathan just watches them eat and read -- wondering if he’ related to these people. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Anyone need the Living Room? I want to watch some TV.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: (without looking up) It’s all yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan turns on the TELEVISION. He approaches the bookcase next to the fireplace. He sift through the albums, before finding one marked: “1992 ~-19 As he flips through the album, he sees pictures of himsel with his parents, at a very young age. The album is fille photos of the whole family. He takes the album and opens a nearby file cabinet, which contains bills, medical info, travel brochures, mortgage info, etc. He reaches his own folder, and pulls out his birth certificate. It reads:

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN THOMAS HARPER
dialogues.text: July 25th, 1991 Certified by Vassar Brothers Hospital Nathan examines both sides of the paper, not really knowi what a fake one would look like.  28.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Whatcha got there? Startled, Nathan quickly turns around. Kevin stares at hi in front of the open file cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I, um... lost my driver’s license. And I need my birth certificate to get a new one.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Oh... Kevin sees the family album lying on the floor. He looks the album and back at Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, Nathan. Your mother and I would like to have a talk with you tomorrow, after school, okay?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Well... we’ll tell you tomorrow. Nathan nods, nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across from Nathan’s High School, from a distance, The OL MAN sits on a park bench, feeding the pigeons. Eventually when no one is looking, he lifts up a pair of tiny binoculars. LENS POV: Nathan gets on his school bus -- he’s the last on. The bus pulls out of the parking lot, into the street and DRIVES away. The Older Man packs up his binoculars, and leaves, as wel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan uses one of the public computers to Google more research. He keeps coming back to the page of the missing child. He stares at the website page of young Steven Spade. He holds up some of his childhood pictures against the compu screen. He’s identical to this boy. He CLICKS the ‘Contact Page’.  29. A 1-800 phone number pops up. Nathan stares at the number, holding his phone. He looks back and forth at the pictures, the phone number, and his cell phone. He decides to dial the number.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello. National Center for Missing Children. How may I help you?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (phone ) Um... I had a question about one of the children listed on your website.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What’s your name, sir?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (phone) Nathan... Nathan Harper.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, Nathan. Which child?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (phone ) Steven Spade. Silence for a moment. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Do you think you’ve seen him, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Older Man is eating a bowl of oatmeal, when he hears Nathan’s CONVERSATION come through his computer. He seems concerned, and puts on a pair of headphones to get a bett listen:

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I think I’ve seen him. Maybe, it was him. I’m not sure-

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What’s your location? Where do you think you saw him?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Bridgewater, Virginia.  30.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Your address?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan’s not quite sure why the Operator would want his address.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OPERATOR
dialogues.text: May I have your address, sir? Nathan feels weird about the conversation -- HANGS up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Older Man opens a program on his computer. The progra has a visual representation of Nathan’s voice and the Operator’s voices. He scans over an earlier part of the conversation, and presses the spacebar:

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello. National Center for Missing Children. How may I help you?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Um... I had a question about one of the children listed on your website... As the conversation continues, the Older Man: - Tracks the 1-800 phone number Nathan called. - Opens the Missing Persons website. - Finds the Steven Spade page, with Nathan’s young pictur it. He picks up his phone, and presses a three-number code. After a BEEP on the other line, he speaks:

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN
dialogues.text: Martin, I think we might have a problem, here. A big problem. I’m going to check on it, now. If I don't hear from you in the hour, I’'ll send the kid to Rasmus. He HANGS up and grabs his trench coat off the back of his chair. He puts on a baseball cap and runs up a set of CREAKY steps before SLAMMING the door behind him.  31. INT. GILLY’S BEDROOM -- NEXT DAY Gilly is looking over the photographs of young Nathan. He examines the back, the front, the edges, the thickness, t amount of glare, etc.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: Definitely not photoshopped. One- hour photo, disposable camera. Looks legit.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Sorry to waste your time, man.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: Nah, dude, this shit’s fun. Let’s scan them in to get a better look. Gilly tosses a few in the scanner. Blows them up on his computer.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here’s you at two years old, at three-ish, and at five... Nathan paces around the room, thinking he’s going crazy.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Man, I need to get a grip. This is so stupid. Forget I said anything-

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Wait a second... Nathan goes over to the computer -- looks at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These two pictures...

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: (motioning) See this picture of you, from when you were two? It’s cropped weird. Gilly zooms in.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Slight outline of a person's shoulder. (motioning) And the same thing in this other photo.  32. Nathan looks back and forth at the two family photos. There’s someone off to the side in both pictures, cropped out.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Maybe it was taken that way.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: Nope. Clearly zoomed in a touch. Gilly takes the pictures out of the scanner and examines back.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Any more photographs of you and your parents?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Not really. Just a ton more of me, by myself.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: So, this is it? Two family photos is all you have from your childhood?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I... I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: Nathan, I got a million embarrassing family photos. A million cheesy pictures of my parents smiling at me like idiots. Enough to make me wanna vomit. And you're telling me... that you only have TWO? INT. NATHAN’S CAR -- DUSK The day has become gloomy -- gray, cloudy skies. The soun of faint THUNDER rumbles in the distance... Nathan pulls up to his house, where he sees his dad worki in the garage -- fixing the weed-wacker. A slight rumble of THUNDER, echoes in the distance, as Na takes a long look at his home.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: My whole life is a lie...  33. EXT. NATHAN’S HOUSE -- DUSK When Nathan gets out of the car, Kevin waves at him. Nath ignores him, and walks towards the front door, where Kare sitting on the steps. Karen senses his frustration.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Turn that frown upside down, man. Nathan KEYS open the door.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You okay? You want me to go?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: No... the last thing I want is for you to go. I just have to figure out how to confront them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan and Karen enter the house. Mara is watching TELEVISION in the other room -- the Fren Open.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: (whispers ) Where’s your bathroom? Nathan points down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Second door on the left. As Karen heads to the bathroom, Nathan sneaks up the stai gets to his room, and closes the door. INT. NATHAN’S BEDROOM -- CONTINUOUS As soon as Nathan enters his room, his cell phone RINGS. doesn’t recognize the number, but picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: OLDER VOICE
dialogues.text: Nathan?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (phone) Yeah?  34.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER VOICE
dialogues.text: Are you alone?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (phone) Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: OLDER VOICE
dialogues.text: I’m a friend of your father’s.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (phone) Um, then why are you calling me? He’s right downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER VOICE
dialogues.text: No... not that father... Nathan freezes. The door bell RINGS downstairs. Nathan runs to the window -- looks down below. NATHAN’S POV: Two MEN, dressed in suits are patiently waiting on his front stoop.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (phone) This is a prank call, right?

dialogues.speaker: OLDER VOICE
dialogues.text: If you’re who I think you are, then this is definitely not a prank call. The doorbell RINGS again. HANGS up.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (phone) Gilly put you up to this, right?

dialogues.speaker: OLDER VOICE
dialogues.text: I want you to think of your earliest memory. Did it involve your parents? If it didn’t, call me back in two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mara opens the door ajar, revealing two well-dressed MEN. They both smile kindly.  35.

dialogues.speaker: MAN 1
dialogues.text: Mrs. Harper?

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: MAN 1
dialogues.text: My name is Alek Nevin, and this is Gregory Hill, from the National Center for Missing Children. Alek shows his identification, as Gregory extends his han Mara shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Is there a problem?

dialogues.speaker: ALEK
dialogues.text: We hate to bother you this late, ma’am, but the NCME received a troubling phone call earlier this evening from your son.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: What kind of phone call?

dialogues.speaker: ALEK
dialogues.text: It’s probably nothing, but we thought we should look into it, to make sure. May we come in?

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Sure. Mara opens the door all the way, and let’s them in.

dialogues.speaker: ALEK
dialogues.text: You have a beautiful place, Mrs. Harper.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ALEK
dialogues.text: My wife and I were looking at houses in this area, as a matter of fact.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Oh, well as you know, it’s a very safe neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen opens the door ajar, and sees Alek and Gregory in t Living Room.  36. INT. NATHAN’S BEDROOM -- SIMULTANEOUS Nathan stares at his cell phone... Finally picks it up. DIALS. After a moment, the MAN answers.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER VOICE
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (phone) A woman sings to me, in the dark, until I fall asleep... And it’s not my mother.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER VOICE
dialogues.text: And what does she sing to you?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (phone ) (slightly embarrassed) What difference does it make?

dialogues.speaker: OLDER VOICE
dialogues.text: Was it ‘Que sera Sera’? Nathan turns white.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (phone) .--How did you know that?

dialogues.speaker: OLDER VOICE
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t have called that website, Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (phone) Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: OLDER VOICE
dialogues.text: Your life is in great danger. You need to get out of that house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alek sits across from Mara, sipping a glass of water. Gregory stays standing, looking around the room.

dialogues.speaker: ALEK
dialogues.text: About an hour ago, your son called the NCME, claiming he thought he might’ve seen himself listed on one of their websites.  37.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: What website was that?

dialogues.speaker: ALEK
dialogues.text: An affiliate site called missing persons dot org. Mara slyly reaches behind the couch cushion, revealing a hidden Glock 19 handgun, tucked inside the zipper.

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Never heard of it.

dialogues.speaker: ALEK
dialogues.text: Is your son around? For us to ask him a couple questions?

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: I think he’s out at the library, right now, if you'd like to come back at another time...

dialogues.speaker: ALEK
dialogues.text: Let me ask you a question, Mrs. Harper. Do you feel it’s appropriate, to take what’s not yours?

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: ALEK
dialogues.text: Do you feel it’s appropriate, to take what was never yours... Jeanine. Mara turns pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen watches the conversation through the cracked open d KAREN’S POV:

dialogues.speaker: MARA
dialogues.text: I think you must have me confused with someone else. My name is Mara Harper.

dialogues.speaker: ALEK
dialogues.text: Well... it can’t hurt to be sure. (beat) Gregory? Gregory faces a silencer at her head.  38. Mara pulls out the Glock and SHOOTS Gregory in the arm be he SHOOTS her twice between the eyes. POP! POP! Karen sees the whole thing -- closes the bathroom door an puts her hands over her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin hears the commotion from in the garage. He looks ou into the driveway, and sees Alek’s unfamiliar car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kevin enters the kitchen from the garage, and hears:

dialogues.speaker: ALEK
dialogues.text: Just deal with the father. I’11 get the kid. Kevin opens one of the cabinets and pushes all the canned food out of the way. In the back of the cabinet, is a sec panel. He opens the panel, revealing a Beretta Tomcat handgun with a silencer. He attaches the silencer, and hides behind the open kitch door. INT. NATHAN’S ROOM -- SIMULTANEOUS Nathan barely hears the SHOTS downstairs. He looks up fro his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER VOICE
dialogues.text: Meet me at Jackie’s Pub in half an hour. Alone. Nathan walks towards his door, wondering what’s going on downstairs. OLDER VOICE (CONT’D) Jackie’s Pub. Nine PM. Be there. Nathan HANGS up -- opens his door, and looks downstairs. EXT. NATHAN’S ROOM -- CONTINUOUS When Nathan peeks out, he sees Alek coming up the stairs a gun.  39. INT. NATHAN’S ROOM -- CONTINUOUS Nathan SHUTS his bedroom door, locks it, and runs towards window, DROPPING his phone on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen LOCKS the bathroom door and crouches in the bathtub She dials 911.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gregory enters the kitchen, Kevin SLAMS the door on hi SHOOTS him twice in the arm and shoulder. POP! POP! Gregory DIVES behind the kitchen island, and SHOOTS Kevin back, just grazing his leg. Kevin UNLOADS the rest of his mag, as he runs to the othe side of the kitchen. POP! POP! POP! Glasses and plates SHATTER as Gregory holds his head down behind the island. Gregory aims his gun at a hanging pot... SHOOTS! The bullet RICOCHETS off the pot, NIPPING Kevin in the ne Gregory’s gun runs out of bullets -- CLICK CLICK CLICK. EXT. NATHAN’S ROOM -- SIMULTANEOUS Alek tries Nathan’s door -- it’s locked. He gets out his and aims at the doorknob. INT. NATHAN’S ROOM -- SIMULTANEOUS Nathan tries lifting his bedroom window, but it’s JAMMED. The doorknob gets SHOT out by Alek. Nathan takes his desk chair and SMASHES it through the window, as the door gets KICKED in. Nathan DIVES out the window... ...landing fifteen feet below, DENTING the hood of Alek’s sedan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Gregory tries to change mags, Kevin tosses his weap away and ATTACKS Gregory, dismantling his gun in two seco  40. They engage in HAND-TO-HAND COMBAT. This goes on for a minute, as Kevin gets the upper-hand. Kevin clearly has a special set of skills for this kind o fighting, and eventually SNAPS Gregory’s neck. Gregory DROPS to the floor. THUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan pulls himself off Alek’s car. He sees his mother... through the open front door, lying on the couch. Her eyes are still open, looking directly a him... she seems serene. He sees Kevin run out from the kitchen, into the Living R They lock eyes for a second...

dialogues.speaker: KEVIN
dialogues.text: Run! Suddenly, Kevin gets SHOT in the chest by Alek, from the of the stairs... He COLLAPSES on to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: NOOOO
dialogues.text: Nathan is shell-shocked. Both his parents are dead. A GUNSHOT snaps him out of it. It’s Alek, walking out the front door, pointing a gun at him. Nathan looks over at his beat up Volvo, and decides to ma run for it. Alek continues to FIRE at him. Nathan manages to reach his car unscathed, and climbs int the driver's seat. He quickly FUMBLES around for his keys more SHOTS hit his windshield. He TURNS the ignition, and PEELS out of the driveway, CRASHING into the black sedan on his way into the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan SPEEDS down the street. After he drives through a Stop Sign, he SLAMS on the breaks. He looks in the rearvi mirror...

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Karen... Should he go back for her?  41. INT. NATHAN’S HOUSE -- MOMENTS LATER Alek walks back inside, checking all the doors, to make s no one else is in the house. He OPENS a downstairs door -- Closet. Moves on. He OPENS another door -- Laundry Room. Empty. Next stop, Karen’s bathroom. Alek checks the doorknob... it’s locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen hides in the darkness, watching the doorknob JIGGLE After a second, the jiggling stops... it gets quiet. Suddenly, two SHOTS erupt, causing the doorknob to fall o of place. BAM! BAM! Alek SWINGS open the door and turns on the lights... The room looks empty, but the shower curtain is closed. A SWIPES open the shower curtain... No one’s there... Karen is hiding behind the door, trembling in fear. If Al turns to his right, he’ll see her face in the mirror. Alek starts turning his head... .--but his cell phone RINGS. He answers it in UKRAINIAN. He calmly speaks in UKRAINIAN, for a moment, as Karen put her hand over mouth to keep dead silent. Finally, Alek leaves the room. Karen slides down the wall, as she hears Alek walking fur away... But her cell phone starts to VIBRATE. She quickly fumbles shut it off-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alek hears Karen’s phone and runs back towards the bathro

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK AND FORTH
dialogues.text: BETWEEN Karen and Alek as Karen SHUTS the door on him and struggles to push it open.  42. The struggle continues, as Alek slowly pushes the door op aiming his gun inside the room. The barrel takes aim at Karen's head. Suddenly, Nathan runs into the house, grabs the gun out o his father’s dead hands, and runs towards Alek.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Hey! Alek turns and sees Nathan. He pulls his arm out of the d and aims his gun at Nathan. But Nathan SHOOTS him three times in the chest. BAM! BAM! BAM! Alek FLIES back into a glass sliding door, and drops to t floor. Nathan runs towards him, holding his sites on Alek. Karen exits the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You okay? Karen nods, clearly distraught. Nathan leans down, as Alek spits up blood.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (angry) Who are you? No response. Nathan grabs his collar.

dialogues.speaker: WHO ARE YOU
dialogues.text: Alek looks into Nathan’s eyes, and works up enough energy speak.

dialogues.speaker: ALEK
dialogues.text: Perhaps... you should ask that question of yourself... Alek smiles slightly, before his eyes glaze over. Dead. Nathan lowers him to the ground, completely shaken with t past ten minutes of his life. A very subtle TICKING can be heard coming from the kitche

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: What's... that sound? Nathan looks up from his grief.  43.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sounds like ticking... They both get up and peek into the kitchen from the hallway... NATHAN AND KAREN’S POV: A wired bomb is strapped to the coffee maker, counting down. 18... 17... 16... But before they can run-

dialogues.speaker: FREEZE
dialogues.text: Two POLICEMAN have entered the house and have their guns Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN 2
dialogues.text: Drop your weapon.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: No, you don’t understand-

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: There’s a bomb in the house!

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN 2
dialogues.text: Drop your weapon! Nathan TOSSES away his gun.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Fuck the weapon, we’re all going to die in TEN SECONDS!

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: These men killed his parents-

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN 1
dialogues.text: You're under arrest. You have the right to remain silent-

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: THERE’S A BOMB ABOUT TO GO OFF!! 8... 7...

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN 2
dialogues.text: Anything you say may be used against you- Nathan grabs Karen’s hand, and swings open the closet doo blocking the Policeman's view. Policeman one FIRES two shots, as Nathan and Karen run ou the back door. BAM! BAM!.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Policeman 2 notices the bomb on the coffee maker. 4... 3... 2...

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN 2, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit. EXT. NATHAN’S HOUSE -- CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: BACK OF HOUSE
dialogues.text: Nathan and Karen run out of the house, and dive into his ground swimming pool. The house EXPLODES. It BLOWS APART into a million pieces. Glass everywhere. Wood spraying. It all goes up in an instantaneous BLAZE.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT OF HOUSE
dialogues.text: Policeman 1 gets INCINERATED, as Policeman 2 manages to escape out the front door and dives onto the yard.

dialogues.speaker: BACK OF HOUSE
dialogues.text: Nathan and Karen stay under water, as a blanket of fire drapes the pool for a few seconds. They hold hands under water, while the fire slowly dissipates. INT. SHERIFF’S OFFICE -- NIGHT CLOSE-UP: A nameplate that reads: Wesley Carr Sheriff WESLEY CARR, 50’s, stocky, sits at his desk with legs up, watching a baseball game and eating a deli sandw His phone RINGS -- picks up.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Wesley. (beat) Wesley quickly sits up, and grabs a pen and paper.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Be right there. He HANGS up and presses the intercom button.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We got an explosion on Casper Creek road. Two officers down.  45. INT. NATHAN’S CAR -- NIGHT Nathan and Karen drive down the highway. Nathan BANGS the steering wheel repeatedly, in frustratio A car BEEPS, nearly hitting them. Nathan SWERVES over to shoulder, and stops the car for a moment. He tries to recoup himself -- leans his head on the steer wheel. His face is red with sadness, confusion and anger. Karen gently touches his cheek, and directs his head towa her, for direct eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: If we call the police, it’1ll give us the chance to explain things, before they jump to conclusions. Nathan nods.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I witnessed the whole thing. As long as I’m with you, you’re fine. I’m not leaving you, you understand? I’m not leaving you. Nathan slowly nods.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have your cell? Nathan shakes his head. Karen checks hers -- it’s soaking wet.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit. Mine’s fried. Nathan looks at the clock. It reads: 8:48 They pull back on to the highway and merge with traffic. EXT. NATHAN’S HOUSE -- LATER THAT NIGHT Sirens flashing everywhere. POLICE OFFICERS, DEPUTY SHERIFFS, and FIREMEN surround the house. Multiple police cars, fire trucks, and ambulances are parked all over the yard, as the fire BLAZES in every direction. On the outskirts of the police tape, neighborhood CIVILIA quietly stand around, trying to get a glimpse of the scen FIREMEN hose down the house, as Wesley listen to Policema 2's statement. Policeman 2 is on a gurney, covered in ash as PARAMEDICS check his ears and eyes.  46.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN 2
dialogues.text: My left ear... I can’t hear anything out of my left ear.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Tell me what you saw.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN 2
dialogues.text: .--he was standing over multiple bodies, holding a gun. At least three victims. Lot of blood. Next thing we know, there’s a bomb... in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Your partner?

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN 2
dialogues.text: (beat) He’s gone... Wesley backs off the gurney, as they load Policeman 2 int the ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Pay attention, everyone. and POLICEMEN surround him.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Close the bridges, close the parks, close the highway entrances. Close everything. I want checkpoints on the entire perimeter of Bridgewater County. Bobby? BOBBY FLETCHER, 35, Deputy Detective, stands attention.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Call Dayton, Spring Creek, Mount Crawford, everybody. Let ‘em know what we're dealing with. Also, check the local gun shops. See if they have any recent red flags.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Yessir.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: And get me an arson expert down here. I want to know what kind of ‘bomb’ we’re talking about. INT. NATHAN’S CAR -- NIGHT Nathan and Karen pull up to a packed Pub. Jackie’s Pub.  47.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: You got a fake I.D.? Karen shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All right. I’m gonna go inside, make the call, and be out in five minutes. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Five minutes. Maximum. EXT. JACKIE’S PUB -- NIGHT As Nathan gets out of his car, and walks into the pub... WE SEE: A blinking red light attached to the underside of his bumper. INT. JACKIE’S PUB -- MOMENTS LATER Nathan enters the Pub, and immediately goes to the paypho He dials: 11 (0.S.)

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (on phone) Hello, my name is Nathan Harper, and I think my life’s in danger. (0.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, slow down, sir. Where are you located?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (on phone) I’m ah... I’m located at... Suddenly, Nathan sees himself on the television. He’s on Evening News with the headline: Bridgewater Teen Suspected of Killing Parents ON TV: Wesley Carr is making a STATEMENT. (0.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir? Sir, where are you located? Nathan slowly lowers the Receiver, as footage of his hous burning down, intercuts with Wesley’s briefing.  48.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: (on TV) He was last seen in a possession of a firearm. And he’s wanted in connection with the death of his parents, two unidentified victims, and a Police Officer.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS REPORTER
dialogues.text: (on TV) Was anyone else with him?

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: (on TV) There was a girl with him. We don't know who she is, or whether or not she survived the explosion.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS REPORTER
dialogues.text: (on TV) What should Bridgewater residents do right now?

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: (on TV) Lock their doors and stay inside. Nathan slowly HANGS UP the phone, and ducks into a dark corner, to watch the news report. As the News cuts to the next segment, Nathan slumps onto bar stool in the deepest, darkest corner of the pub. He’s in big trouble. EXT. JACKIE’S PUB -- SIMULTANEOUS A Police Car pulls into the parking lot. It slowly scans license plates. Karen sees the squad car, moving towards her. When the car approaches, and shines its spotlight inside Nathan’s vehicle... Karen is gone. INT. JACKIE’S PUB -- SIMULTANEOUS Some PATRONS begin to take notice of Nathan. They begin pointing at him, recognizing him from the news. Nathan tries to make his way out the front door, but thre FRAT BOYS block him. As he tries to get by, they hold him back.  49.

dialogues.speaker: FRAT BOY
dialogues.text: It’s him! Two CONSTRUCTION WORKERS help in holding Nathan down and disarming him, while he STRUGGLES to get free.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTRUCTION WORKER
dialogues.text: Call the police! The BARTENDER picks up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: You don’t understand. I’m innocent.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTRUCTION WORKER
dialogues.text: Tell it to the police. Nathan PUNCHES one of the Frat Boys in the face, attempti to get free. A Worker PUNCHES him back, trying to hold hi down. Nathan BITES one of the Worker’s hands, and he SCREAMS in agony, as two other GUYS KICK him and hold him down. A LOUD GUNSHOT explodes into the ceiling, causing everyon SCREAM and duck for cover... It’s the OLDER MAN, holding a smoking sawed-off shotgun. He aims it at the men holding Nathan down.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN
dialogues.text: Let him go. The Frat Boys and Construction Workers slowly let go of Nathan’s collar, and stand up with their hands in the air The bar turns quiet. OLDER MAN (CONT’D) Straighten out his collar. The Construction Worker straightens Nathan’s collar up.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell him you’re sorry, and that you believe he’s innocent. The Construction worker slowly faces Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: CONSTRUCTION WORKER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry... and I believe you're innocent.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN
dialogues.text: Good boy. Now kindly open the door, and let us out.  50. The Construction Worker opens the exit door, as Nathan an the Older Man exit the premises. EXT. JACKIE’S PUB -- CONTINUOUS When Nathan and the Older Man rush out of the Pub, The Ol Man JAMS the door with a chair. Nathan quickly notices the SQUAD CAR, shining its spotlig on his car. NATHAN’S POV: Karen is not inside his car. Nathan starts walking towards his car, when the Older Man stops him.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN
dialogues.text: Your car’s been identified. There’s no going back.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Karen...

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN
dialogues.text: The police can’t protect you, son. You come with me, or you die. Those are your choices. The front door of the bar is being PUSHED open from the inside. The Older Man guides Nathan over to his pick-up Truck and opens the door for him.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Wait a second. I don’t even know you.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN
dialogues.text: I’m the one who told you to get out of that house. The Older Man gets in the car and quickly starts the ENGI Nathan sees the OFFICERS starting to look in his directio He gets in the car. As they DRIVE off, a large SUV parked nearby, turns it’s headlights on, and follows them. INT. OLDER MAN’S TRUCK -- MOMENTS LATER Nathan looks at the Older Man as he speeds down the highw  51.

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN
dialogues.text: The police... weak to the advances of outside influence. Prone to infection. They’1ll be bought by tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: OLDER MAN
dialogues.text: I’m a Bounty Hunter, hired by your father fourteen years ago to find and protect you, after they took you away.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Protect me? How come I’ve never seen you before?

dialogues.speaker: BOUNTY HUNTER
dialogues.text: Because, I only found you a few months ago.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: A few months ago? It took you fourteen years to find me?

dialogues.speaker: BOUNTY HUNTER
dialogues.text: No pictures, no name, no DNA. It was a one in a million shot at finding you, kid, believe me. The agency doesn’t take any chances.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: What agency?

dialogues.speaker: BOUNTY HUNTER
dialogues.text: Open up the glove compartment. Nathan opens the glove compartment. There are some offici papers and tickets inside.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: What are these?

dialogues.speaker: BOUNTY HUNTER
dialogues.text: Tomorrow morning, you'll take the 10:24 train to Modesto. There, you'll meet a man named Paul Rasmus. He’1ll know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Paul Rasmus... What does he look like?

dialogues.speaker: BOUNTY HUNTER
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Never met him.  52.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: You never met him? Listen, I don’t know who you are, or what this is all about. But, you better start answering some of my questions, or I’m jumping out of this car. Starting with, who are my real parents?

dialogues.speaker: BOUNTY HUNTER
dialogues.text: Yesterday, you were a normal kid, thinking about college and pussy and all that other bullshit. Today, you’re a wanted man. By tomorrow morning, there’1ll be an entire country hunting you down. So, you better forget about who your parents are, and start worrying about who you are. A BEEPING HORN and bright headlights come out of nowhere. The large SUV RAMS into their truck and starts PUSHING th across the highway. They try to get out of the vehicle, b are wedged inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a few seconds, they reach a bridge, and get PUSHED the edge, landing thirty feet into a shallow river. CRASH The vehicle is half in the water, and half out. Three MEN get out of the SUV with automatic weapons, and start SHOOTING into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan feels his head, as bullets BOUNCE off the windshie it must be bullet proof. He looks over at the Bounty Hunt who isn’t moving.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (shaking him) Hey! HEY! Nathan tries to pry the Bounty Hunter from his seatbelt, notices a large gash on the side of his head. He’s dead. Bullets continue to RICOCHET off the car, as the water FI the vehicle. Nathan grabs the tickets, and pulls the door handle -- it JAMMED. He struggles to open it, but the door is crushed shut. He quickly climbs over the Bounty Hunter, to go out his door.  53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan KICKS open the door and DIVES into the river, as bullets WHIZ past him through the water. The river flows rapidly, and Nathan floats away from the bridge quickly. He sees the MEN crossing the bridge with bright flashlights, trying to spot him. He puts his head underwater, and glides downstream. His tickets get lost in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan washes up on a rocky shore. He’s exhausted and in pain. He crawls over some rocks, and finally passes out. EXT. NATHAN’S HOUSE -- DAWN The house is a black, smoking, pile of hot ash. The skele frame is all that’s left of Nathan’s entire past. Wesley stands by, as FORENSICS place POLICEMAN 1 into a b bag. The Policeman is burnt to a crisp. Fletcher arrives with another MAN; JACK SHAPIRO, 40’s, ca and unassuming.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Boss, this is Jack Shapiro, from the Marshal’s Office. He’s the arson expert you asked for. Wesley shakes hands with Jack.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Pleased to meet you, Mr. Shapiro. As you can see, we have quite a mess here. Jack nods, while looking at the blackened structure.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now ah, whatever you find in there, you tell me about it first. Not the Marshal’s office. Understood?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Not a problem. Jack quietly enters the house, carrying his investigative materials. A DEPUTY approaches Wesley with his CB.  54.

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Sir, they found a truck in the river up off Route 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large crane lifts the Bounty Hunter’s truck out of the water. His corpse is inside, still wedged into the driver seat. The bridge is blocked off by POLICE and AMBULANCES. Wesley shakes his head, ‘What a mess’.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan sleeps on the rocks, as the sun rises.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKNESS
dialogues.text: An echo-y rendition of ‘Que Sera Sera’ PLAYS, way off in distance. The Shadowed Woman appears out of the dark. Her face is j barely in the darkness, while her she holds up young Nath and SPINS him around. It's a joyous, surreal moment, as LAUGHING can be heard. laughing -- the laughing of a small child. When her face comes into the light... she's a skeleton.

dialogues.speaker: END OF DREAM
dialogues.text: Nathan wakes up from the nightmare. His blood is dried, a his lips are chapped. He’s cold. He slowly gets up, and heads into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELEVATOR MUSIC fills the aisles. Nathan, wearing dark sunglasses, sift through the aisles, looking for certain survival items. He grabs a backpack, electric buzzer, cheap binoculars, and some carving knive

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Nathan reaches the CASHIER, 20, stoner-dude. He hands the Cashier a soaked twenty dollar bill.  55. The Cashier grabs the tip of the bill, daintily, and slow peels it open. It’s gross looking. He looks at Nathan in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan buzzes all of his hair off to change his appearanc He puts some band-aids and gauze on his wounds and scratc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan puts in a quarter, and DIALS the phone.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (phone ) Gilly, it’s me.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Dude, what the fuck?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan waits by the side of the road, behind a tree. A car's HEADLIGHTS appear in the distance. When the car approaches, it pulls over in front of Nathan. It’s Gilly. Nathan tosses his backpack into the trunk, an gets in the passenger seat -- ducks down. INT. GILLY’S CAR -- CONTINUOS Gilly drives the speed limit, listening to the LOCAL NEWS Nathan’s name comes up, constantly.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: Cops everywhere, man. You’re lucky you made it outside of town.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I’m lucky to be alive.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: Check my wallet.  56. Nathan opens Gilly’s wallet -- three fake ID’s with Natha picture on them.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: What’s all this?

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: Three different identities in three different states. I even photoshopped off your hair, to match. You’re gonna be one covert motherfucker. Nathan scans through the IDS -- Virginia, New York, California. Different names are listed on each card.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: This is my finest, finest work, dude. What you are holding, are works of art.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Thanks, man.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: You need a gun? Gilly lifts up a blanket on the back seat. An assortment handguns are hidden underneath.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: You know how I feel about guns.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: Well, if you don’t turn yourself in, and there are people trying to kill you... I’m gonna have to insist you take one of those bad boys for protection.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I’m not turning myself in.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: Maybe you can still explain everything.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Explain what? That my parents weren’t who they said they were? Who’s gonna believe that? Especially now that my house is gone, the evidence is gone, and the cops think I’m a mass murderer.  57.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: Good point. But it gets worse every minute you’re on the run, dude.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: If I do turn myself in, it won't be to these local schmocal cops. I/’11 go to the FBI if I don’t find this Rasmus guy. Gilly starts pulling over.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why are we stopping? Nathan sees Karen come out of the woods, and watches her in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
dialogues.text: She called right after you, dude!

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: I just got out of an internet cafe.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Well, I’m really happy for you, but you shouldn’t be with me, right now.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: No, listen. They erased that website with your picture on it. It’s like it never existed.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Listen to me, Karen. I’m in a lot of trouble, here. My fate is looking pretty grim. But you... you haven’t been identified yet. You should get out, while you still can. Suddenly, Karen's name gets mentioned on the RADIO:

dialogues.speaker: RADIO ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Police now suspect that the girl who escaped with Nathan Harper, may be Karen Lowell, his next door neighbor. She’s been missing since last night, and was working on a school project with the suspect for the past week...  58. Karen SHUTS it off... slowly leans back in her seat. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: I’m coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gilly drops off Nathan and Karen. After Nathan SHUTS the door, he leans in the window, to s Gilly’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: No guns, brother.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY
