dialogues.text: You better come back to me, man. I only have one best friend. Nathan smiles -- nods.

dialogues.speaker: GILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m serious. You be careful.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I will. Nathan walks with Karen into the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Station is filled with COMMUTERS and TRAVELERS, busil walking to their allotted trains. Karen and Nathan enter the Station. The large clock reads: 10:16

dialogues.speaker: TICKET COUNTER
dialogues.text: Nathan reaches the TICKET TELLER, 40's, female, glasses.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Two tickets for Modesto, please?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Yes. How long is the trip?  59.

dialogues.speaker: TICKET TELLER
dialogues.text: Three days, three nights. The Ticket Teller PRINTS up the tickets, while Nathan han over the cash. TICKET TELLER (CONT’D) (handing tickets over) Better hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packed with PASSENGERS and PORTERS. Nathan and Karen reach the CONDUCTOR. He examines their tickets, looks at them, and lets them o the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen and Nathan make their way through the food car, bef entering the:

dialogues.speaker: SLEEPING CAR HALLWAY
dialogues.text: They reach Room 42 -- open their door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as the Conductor is about to close the door, a MAN r up, just in time to hand the Conductor a ticket. He’s mid 30’s, wearing glasses and a casual suit. We’ll c him THE STRANGER. The Stranger kindly smiles at the Conductor, who lets him the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen and Nathan enter their room, and put down their bag Nathan looks out the window, hearing the WHISTLE BLOW, an watching the train leave the platform. He shuts the blind opens the overhead compartment with a cot. Karen turns on the lamp.  60.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: You can sleep on the cot tonight. I’1l take the couch.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Who are we supposed to meet at the end of this rainbow?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Some guy named Rasmus. Paul Rasmus.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: That’s it?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (defeated) That’s all I got. I keep thinking I’m in this nightmare, and I’m gonna wake up, at any moment. But, it doesn’t happen.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Maybe we go to the FBI? Nathan shrugs. Karen takes out a First Aid Kit and grabs some cotton bal and begins dabbing some of Nathan’s facial scars.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You've got glass stuck all over you. Take off your shirt. Nathan reluctantly takes off his shirt. Karen picks out some small shards of glass from Nathan's skin. He WINCES.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold still. After she’s through, they look at each other. They lean i to each other slightly, on the verge of a kiss... Finally:

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I... I’m kind of tired. Haven't slept in twenty four hours. Nathan nods. He backs off.

dialogues.speaker: TRAIN HALLWAY
dialogues.text: The Stranger BUMPS into a CAR ATTENDANT.  61.

dialogues.speaker: CAR ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir.

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: My fault. When the Attendant disappears, the Stranger takes out a s of paper, which he pick-pocketed -- a list of all the passengers. The Stranger scans the list -- no listing for ‘Harper’.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM 42
dialogues.text: Nathan sleeps on the couch, before Karen wakes him up.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: I’m going to get some food. Nathan nods, wiping his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Be careful. Karen nods and grabs some cash. On her way out the door, thinks of something:

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: I'll knock twice before keying in. If you don’t hear two knocks... it’s not me.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Okay. Karen leaves.

dialogues.speaker: DINING CAR
dialogues.text: Karen is on line at the buffet. She LOPS on potatoes and green beans and chicken -- enough to feed an army. The Stranger gets on line next to her -- smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: Lot of food there. You must be hungry. Karen smiles and nods, grabbing a couple of rolls. She ha her food ticket to the BUFFET LADY at the end of the long table. The Buffet Lady looks at the amount of food on her plate. Karen, not wanting to cause a scene, hands over Nathan’s ticket, as well. The Stranger sees the second ticket -- he knows she’s not alone. Karen leaves the food car. The Stranger puts down his food, and follows her.

dialogues.speaker: SLEEPING CAR HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Karen walks down the hallway, balancing the food with her hands. Without Karen noticing, the Stranger comes up behind her. Another PASSENGER walks by, passing both of them. When th Passenger is gone, the Stranger puts his hand over Karen' mouth. The food FALLS to the ground -- plate SHATTERS. The Stranger PUNCHES Karen twice in the face, knocking he out. He quickly keys into his room, and HAULS her inside. He comes back out to clean up the mess, when a STEWARD happens to walk by.

dialogues.speaker: STEWARD
dialogues.text: Oh, did you drop it?

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: (kindly) Yeah, sorry...

dialogues.speaker: STEWARD
dialogues.text: It’s no problem, I'll clean it up.

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: Thank you so much.

dialogues.speaker: STEWARD
dialogues.text: I'll get you a new food ticket in a few minutes, okay?  63.

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: Thank you. That would be great. The Stranger enters his room -- SHUTS the door.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM 13
dialogues.text: The Stranger drags Karen further inside his room -- her f bloody, her body limp. He leans over her, takes out a gun and jams the silencer deep in to her mouth. He checks her pockets for her room key -- finds it. Room

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: Do you understand the importance of telling the truth, Karen? Karen, barely conscious, nods.

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is there a secret knock, or password, I should know about before entering the room? Karen slowly shakes her head ‘no’, tears forming in her e The Stranger looks deep into her eyes -- she’s lying.

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Such a shame. He takes out a cigar cutter with his other hand, and plac her left index finger inside the cutter. He applies pressure with the cutter, clamping down on her finger, but not all the way. Karen emits MUFFLED SCREAMS of agony.

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is there a secret knock, or password, I should know about before entering the room? Karen slowly nods.

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And what is it? He takes the gun out of her mouth for her to speak.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: (shortness of breath) Two... knocks.  64.

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER
dialogues.text: Two knocks, then enter? Karen nods, CRYING. The Stranger looks deep into her eyes -- it’s the truth. He slowly takes her finger out of the cutter -- smiles.

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If I go there, and you’ve lied to me... He SNAPS the cutter. SNAP. SNAP. SNAP.

dialogues.speaker: STRANGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One by one.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM 42
dialogues.text: Nathan peaks through the half-open blinds, watching the w go by. He looks over at Karen’s coat -- a small bottle of PepperBall Pepper Spray sticks out of her inside pocket. Nathan smiles, and picks it up. The label reads: Warning: Severe Irritant He puts the bottle down and checks his watch -- it’s taki Karen a while to come back.

dialogues.speaker: SLEEPING CAR HALLWAY
dialogues.text: The Stranger enters the hallway, as another FEMALE PASSEN walks by. The Stranger smiles kindly at the Passenger, bu as soon as she disappears around the corner, his smile disappears, as well. He approaches Room 42 -- KNOCKS twice, before KEYING into room.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM 42
dialogues.text: The Stranger enters, gun in hand -- no sign of Nathan. The Stranger quietly moves towards the bathroom, and KICK open the door -- no Nathan. He looks up at the closed upper compartment -- aims his g at it. He reaches for the handle, slowly... then PULLS it down... No Nathan.  65.

dialogues.speaker: DINING CAR
dialogues.text: Nathan is scanning the dining car, wondering where Karen could be. He doesn’t see her, and heads back towards his room.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM 42
dialogues.text: When Nathan reaches his room, he gets out his keys to ope the door, but notices something odd next to the doorknob. Blood. Just a small speck of blood above the doorknob. He HEARS someone in the room, and quickly steps to the si The Stranger exits the room, looking in the other directi Nathan quickly sneaks inside the room, and SHUTS the door but the Stranger CATCHES it before it’s completely closed Nathan PUNCHES his fingers and tries to JAM them by SLAMM closed the door. But the Stranger is stronger than Nathan, and PUSHES back open the door, GRABBING Nathan by the neck. They struggle against each other, until Nathan momentaril gets the upper hand. He holds his arm around the Stranger neck, as tight as he can. The Stranger, arms wailing around, SHOOTS his gun three times, BLASTING the window into pieces. The WIND BLOWS hard from outside, as the Stranger manages get free from Nathan's grip, and grabs Nathan’s neck, in return. Their STRUGGLE reaches the newly destroyed window as the Stranger leans Nathan onto shards of glass, while grasping his neck. The Stranger takes out a tranquilizer gun, and presses it against Nathan’s neck. But Nathan grabs Karen's Pepper Spray, and SQUIRTS it in Stranger’s face. As the Stranger GROANS in pain, Nathan grabs his tranquil gun and INJECTS it twice into the Stranger’s adam’s apple causing his eyes to BUG OUT in agony. Nathan holds the gun on his neck, as the Stranger eventua collapses on top of him. Nathan rolls the Stranger off of him, and quickly checks pockets -- Ukrainian passport, Russian memos, and photogr of Nathan, from newspaper clippings. He takes all of it. He looks for the Stranger’s key -- finds it -- room 13.  66. As Nathan lifts the Stranger up, he wakes up! He starts GRABBING for Nathan’s neck again, YELLING something in UKRAINIAN. Nathan flops him on to the ledge of the window -- pushing off the train. He watches the Stranger land on the parall tracks, SNAPPING his neck. But he also sees a YOUNG BOY, in the next car, leaning ou the window, witnessing the whole thing. The boy looks directly at Nathan -- oops.

dialogues.speaker: SLEEPING CAR HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Nathan exits his room, with his backpack and Karen's thin On his way down the hallway, the train comes to a SCREECH HALT. Nathan falls backwards, along with a couple other PASSENG but quickly gets up and runs down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: NEXT CAR
dialogues.text: Nathan reaches Room 13, and gets out the Stranger’s key. Sounds of COMMOTION can be heard in the distance, as peop are realizing that a man was thrown off the train.

dialogues.speaker: ROOM 13
dialogues.text: Nathan enters Room 13, and sees Karen, beaten, bloodied, passed out, and tied to the radiator. Worried for her life, Nathan leans over her, and checks h pulse.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (whispers ) Karen? Karen? She's conscious, but very weak.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say something.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: (barely audible) Something... Nathan helps her up.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Stay with me... Stay with me...  67. The train comes to a final JOLT, as the TRAIN WORKERS investigate the situation, somewhere outside. Nathan is on borrowed time -- he needs to think fast.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you walk if I help you? Karen nods.

dialogues.speaker: IN BETWEEN CARS
dialogues.text: Nathan pulls the ‘emergency’ latch on the exit door, and off the train, holding Karen as a crutch. The ALARM RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan helps Karen off the train. He sees WORKERS and CONDUCTORS, way off in the distance, at the end of the tr surrounding the Stranger’s body. He ducks into the woods with Karen, before anyone can see them. INT. NATHAN’S HOUSE -- DAY Jack Shapiro, and his partner, MARCUS LANG, 30’s, Nigeria tall and slender, quietly chip away at evidence within th house. Marcus removes a piece of molding on the ceiling, as Jack gets up on a step ladder to review what’s behind it. Jack reaches inside, and grabs a tiny plastic ball, with wires attached to it. He dusts off some ash, revealing a tiny glass lens on one side. Jack and Marcus look at each other in confirmation. INT. WESLEY’S OFFICE -- DAY Wesley, Jack, Marcus, and Fletcher are present. All are seated. Jack lights up a cigarette, admiring a knitted quilt, han on Wesley’s wall.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Love the quilt.  68.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Thank you. My wife made it. Marcus dumps five of the plastic balls on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell are these?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Pinhole cameras. Found them in five different rooms of the house, including Nathan Harper’s bedroom. Wesley picks one up, and examines it. Marcus dumps more objects on the desk, as they discuss.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Well, what the hell does that mean? Voyeurism?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: They look like surveillance cameras, monitored from a remote location, not within the house. The snipped wires suggest communication was cut off some time ago. Whether his parents knew about them or not, is anyone’s guess. Wesley turns his attention to another pile of wires and gadgetry.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: And this?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: RDX plastic explosive. The Russians used these to blow out foxholes in Afghanistan in the 80’s. This is the skunk that wiped out the house, and you can’t find it at the local candy store. Wesley points at a melted gun, next to the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: JACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's a Stetchkin APS pistol. Also made in Russia. Ukraine, specifically. Custom made to fit an M4 silencer. Again, these toys cannot be bought in America.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: You're saying?  69.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: I’m saying when Forensics checks the unidentified victim’s teeth, it’s possible they won’t find a match in the United States. My recommendation, for what it’s worth, is to contact the FBI.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Let’s see what Forensics says. Until then, I’d appreciate it if we kept this information in this room. Jack and Marcus get up to leave.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Not a problem. But think of it this way: If this kid has even a shred of innocence... then you'd better find him, before the Russians do.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: We’ve got over seventy men out there, looking for him. Jack opens the door to exit. One last thought.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Personally, I’d be most worried about the cameras.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Why’s that?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Because there’s always someone behind them.... Someone who knows more than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LENS POV: Nathan walks Karen through a small, near-desert town in middle America. Photos are SNAPPED. Only a few store fronts are open. The rest of the buildin are condemned or were closed years ago. A couple scattere cars and a strong WIND are the only signs of life here. LENS POV: More SNAPPED photos of Nathan and Karen enterin small Pharmacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan and Karen enter the tiny ma-and-pop shop.  70. An OLD STOREKEEPER mans the counter. An OLD WOMAN, presumably the Storekeeper’s wife, is stocking shelves. Nathan approaches the Storekeeper.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: OLD STOREKEEPER
dialogues.text: Drug store.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: What state?

dialogues.speaker: OLD STOREKEEPER
dialogues.text: (confused) Kentucky. The Storekeeper looks at Karen -- black eye, dried blood, smeared make-up.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: We were in... a car accident. We need first aid.

dialogues.speaker: OLD STOREKEEPER
dialogues.text: (motions ) Right over there. Karen finds the First Aid Kits, and takes one.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: You got a bathroom we could use for a few minutes?

dialogues.speaker: OLD STOREKEEPER
dialogues.text: We got a hospital, which is where that girl belongs. The Old Woman approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: Oh come on, George. Nearest hospital’s fifteen miles away. (to Nathan) I'll fix her up in the back room. Hospital would charge you a thousand dollars for a band-aid.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (smiles) Thank you. The Old Woman leads Karen into the back room. An awkward silence between Nathan and the Storekeeper. Th  71.

dialogues.speaker: OLD STOREKEEPER
dialogues.text: Population here is a hundred and twelve... and you ain’t one of ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: We were coming to visit some friends, and-

dialogues.speaker: OLD STOREKEEPER
dialogues.text: What friends? Who? I know everyone.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Ummm... I better go check on my... girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: OLD STOREKEEPER
dialogues.text: How about the men in the shiny car, across the street? Are they your ‘friends’ too? Nathan looks out the store window. NATHAN’S POV: Two MEN sit in a car across the street, looking back at him. Nathan turns pale. He can’t run forever -- notices the handle of a gun tucked behind the Storekeeper’s counter. throws down a wad of money.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I'll give you fifty dollars for the shotgun behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: OLD STOREKEEPER
dialogues.text: You outta your mind?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: OLD STOREKEEPER
dialogues.text: I ain’t sellin’ you my shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Two hundred dollars. The Storekeeper grabs his shotgun from behind the counter and aims it at Nathan’s face.

dialogues.speaker: OLD STOREKEEPER
dialogues.text: You've got two minutes to get out of my store. Get your girl and go.  72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Woman has cleaned up Karen a bit. They’re smiling and getting along fine, when Nathan walks in.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (to woman) Excuse me, ma’am. May I have a moment?

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: Of course. The Woman leaves the room as Nathan kneels down next to Karen.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Better. You?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (beat) When I saw you, in that room... not knowing what had happened... It made me so angry, my heart sank. (beat) I thought you were dead. Karen realizes Nathan is coming undone, a little.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: I’m not dead, okay? I’m right here, and we’re both alive, and that’s what’s important. We're going to figure this thing out, okay? Nathan nods, not believing her. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: There are two men outside, waiting for us.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Are you sure? Nathan nods, as Karen gets up and tries the window. It BUDGES a little.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then we have to get out of here.  73.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Maybe we should walk up to them and ask them what they want? Karen opens the window all the way.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Not an option.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: What if there is no Paul Rasmus? And even if there is, what’s he going to do for me? I’m a dead man.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Nathan, if you lose it, then I’m going to lose it. Karen grabs Nathan and forces him up.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're going out this window, together. Understand? Nathan nods, as he helps Karen up to go out the window fi

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: As soon as Karen lands on the ground outside, a car PULLS out of nowhere and blocks her in the alley.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Karen! Three MEN get out of the car to grab her, as she runs in other direction. But another car blocks the other side. The Men GRAB Karen holding her mouth, as Nathan stands helpless in the windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan BURSTS out of the back room and SWIPES the shotgun of the Storekeeper’s hands.

dialogues.speaker: OLD STOREKEEPER
dialogues.text: Hey! Nathan walks up to the front, and SWINGS the door open, aiming the shotgun at the Men across the street.  74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan COCKS the shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: What do you want with us!? The Men exit the car and walk towards him.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: WHAT DO YOU WANT?! Don’t get any closer! Suddenly, multiple MEN come out of the storefronts into t street. One of them is FRANK BOYER, 50's, well-dressed. H takes an I.D. out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: (calmly) Put the gun down, Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: One step closer, and I pull the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: We’re CIA, Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: My name is Frank Boyer, and I work for the CIA. You can check my identification. Boyer tosses his ID in front of Nathan. Nathan picks up the card, and examines it, then tosses th back towards Boyer.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t know a fake one from a real one, anyway. Suddenly, DR. BENNETT, Nathan’s Therapist, gets out of a nearby vehicle, holding his hands up in the air.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: He works for us, Nathan. He’s just one of many people, just like your parents, hired to protect you.  75.

dialogues.speaker: DR. BENNETT
dialogues.text: It’s okay, Nathan. It’s going to be all right.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Look around you, Nathan. Take a long, good look. Nathan glances around at over twenty AGENTS, standing in street.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No one has a gun... no one’s threatening you. Nathan realizes he’s right. Tears of anger and confusion swell in Nathan’s eyes. He s a car pull up, with Karen sitting in the back seat. She seems to be all right.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: If you’re the CIA, then what’s my real name?

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Nathan Spade.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Steven Spade.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Steven was your middle name. It was always Nathan... Ever since you were born.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: And how would you know that?

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: (beat) Because I named you. INT. DR. BENNETT’S OFFICE -- NIGHT Wesley and Fletcher observe Nathan’s Therapist’s office. It’s been emptied out. The drawers, the shelves, the desk everything is gone.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: A disappearing shrink. That’s a new one.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Secretary?  76.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Gone, too. No one’s heard from either one of them since last night.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Well, we better check for prints.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don’t bother. He’s one of ours. Wesley and Fletcher turn to find two MEN, wearing casual suits, inside the room.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: MAN 1
dialogues.text: Yes you can, Mr. Carr. (pulls out a badge) We work for the CIA, and we have Nathan Harper in our custody. Wesley examines the badge.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: MAN 1
dialogues.text: That’s confidential.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Well, I have an officer in the hospital who isn’t gonna like that answer.

dialogues.speaker: MAN 1
dialogues.text: Nathan Harper is cleared of any charges you or the state of Virginia have against him.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Under what authority?

dialogues.speaker: MAN 2
dialogues.text: Under the authority of the Vice President of the United States, as well as the Attorney General.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: (beat) Who the hell is this kid? Man 1 takes out a briefcase, with some folders and photographs inside. He hands a pile of folders to Wesley.  77.

dialogues.speaker: MAN 1
dialogues.text: You're going to take your Deputies and Officers off the case, and tell the Press that you found Nathan Harper, dead, near Casper Creek. Wesley opens the folder, and sees doctored photos of Nath drowned by the Creek.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ...

dialogues.speaker: MAN 2
dialogues.text: We'll send you a ‘prep agent’ in an hour, who will provide you with your statements and reports. He’ll guide you through the next few days.

dialogues.speaker: MAN 1
dialogues.text: You never saw us. We were never here. The Men get ready to leave, as Wesley looks over the materials, dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: One last thing. The Men stop.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where'd you find him?

dialogues.speaker: MAN 1
dialogues.text: Booneville, Kentucky. Hour ago. Looks like your checkpoints didn’t work out. They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan sits inside the moving van. Frank Boyer sits across from him. Another agent, AGENT 1, 40's, bulky, stands in the dark corner, like a bodyguard. Boyer pushes a cup of coffee in front of Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Where’s Karen?  78.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: She’s on her way back home. Nathan looks around the van: It’s teched out with computers and monitoring equipment - wires, taps, computer screens, headphones, gadgets, lapto walkie-talkies, landlines, foreign devices, etc.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Home? She won’t be safe there. Maybe you didn’t get the memo, but there are people trying to kill us.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: We're not so sure they’re trying to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (amused) Really? Because I’ve been shot at, stabbed, bombed, and nearly strangled to death in the past twenty four hours. I don’t think these people are trying to be my friends.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Yet, you’re still alive. Boyer tosses a folder in front of Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: What’s this?

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: It’s a comprehensive list of every enemy you have, dead or alive. Nathan opens the folder, revealing photographs of Alek Ne Gregory Hill, the Stranger, Victor Kozlow, and other file people Nathan’s never seen before. It contains their aliases, height, weight, age, affiliations, and last know points and places of interest.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: This is a joke, right? I don’t even know these people...

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: But they know you. And more importantly, they know your father. Nathan looks up from the folder.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: My father?  79. The Van STOPS. The back doors open, revealing a runway of private airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyer, Nathan, and a dozen AGENTS walk across a long runw to get to a large private plane.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Your father is a Black Ops agent named Martin Spade. Nicknamed ‘the Locust’. He’s a deep clandestine operative, who’s been working in the field for over twenty five years. Because of the nature of his work, he has a long list of enemies.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: So now they’re my enemies?

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: No one at the CIA even knows what he looks like any more, except for me. If any of the people in that folder get a hold of you, they could use you to lure Martin out. And if they lure him out, it could put the United States at risk. You are clearly worth more alive, then dead.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Well, that’s a relief. I feel so much more comfortable now.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: You should, under our protective custody.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Where was your protective custody when my house blew up?

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Surveillance was pulled three years ago, at your parents request.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Because they wanted you to live a normal life. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BOYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I agreed to pull the plug, as long as a third party kept a watchful eye over you. That was Dr. Barrett. Boyer stops at the steps leading to the plane -- looks at Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They loved you, Nathan. They took the opportunity to bring you up, and seized it with everything they had to offer... I’m truly sorry that all this has happened. But we're going to get through this thing, all right. I need you to trust me.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Trust needs to be earned. You're not anywhere near that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wesley is at the cash window, waiting for the female EMPL to find him on her computer. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: Wire transfer from Mr. Conklin?

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: EMPLOYEE
dialogues.text: Here it is. It’ll be a thirty two dollar fee, sir.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: (smiles) Not a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wesley gets on a pay phone and DIALS a number he has writ on a piece of paper. A STRANGE VOICE answers.

dialogues.speaker: STRANGE VOICE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, I, ah... received your kind donation. No response. Awkward silence.  81.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But you should know that the CIA came to me today. They found him in Booneville, Kentucky. I can give you a heads up with any information they give me, if you want—

dialogues.speaker: STRANGE VOICE
dialogues.text: We won’t be needing you any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAN with the strange voice hangs up the cell phone... It's Victor Kozlow. He's fifteen years older from when we last saw him (at the beginning of the script). He’s sitti on a couch, looking out a bay window. He places the cell phone inside a leather case with twent other cell phones -- ZIPS it up. He picks up a pair of binoculars and looks out the window. KOZLOW’'S POV: Nathan’s burnt down house. Just as we realize Kozlow’s location, we see a DEAD NEIGH lying on the carpet. His throat’s been slit. Becker (also fifteen years older) stands over the Dead Ma wiping the blood off his knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Boyer and TOM SHEALY, 50’s, sit across from Nathan, the back of the plane. Tom is another agent.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Nathan, this is Tom Shealy. He'll be helping us, over the next few hours.

dialogues.speaker: SHEALY
dialogues.text: Hello, Nathan. Tom Shealy extends his hand, but Nathan ignores it. He ke his sights on Boyer.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Helping us with what? Boyer nods for Tom to explain.  82.

dialogues.speaker: SHEALY
dialogues.text: When you were three years old, a former Ukrainian KGB Operative named Victor Kozlow tracked down and killed one of our agents. During the siege, he found a folder containing sensitive information about Martin’s life... including pictures of you and the fact that you existed. Shealy hands Nathan the file on Kozlow, along with the photograph of Nathan from when he was younger.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: And where was my mother during all this?

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Your mother... was the agent that Kozlow killed. I’m sorry... Boyer hands Nathan a photograph of his real mother. (The woman from the beginning of the script). She’s smiling, holding a young Nathan in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Her name was Lorna Gibbons. Nathan is immediately affected by the image. Things start coming back to him.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: The woman in Nathan's dreams comes out of the shadows... the woman in this picture. She finally has a face.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Boyer.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sometimes, photos of you would appear on the web. We take them down, track them. Dead end.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: So, why don’t you guys go out there and get this asshole? Boyer and Shealy look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: SHEALY
dialogues.text: Because he disappeared a few years ago. He was the top assassin in the Ukraine, with an allied Soviet network. Untouchable. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SHEALY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On CIA’s most wanted list... Then one day, poof... gone. Disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: An apparent retirement.

dialogues.speaker: SHEALY
dialogues.text: Of which he’s been brought out of. Our Special Activities Division is up in arms about it, to say the least. Nathan looks back at the picture of his mother.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I want to meet my father.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: (to Shealy) Tom, can we have a minute? Tom obliges -- walks up front.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm afraid that’s impossible.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: The reason you were hidden away in the first place was to protect your father from being compromised by any threats on his loved ones. He has no friends, no family, and therefore no distractions.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: But he does have a family. He has a son.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Not that he knows of. Nathan is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: The day you were born, your father was half way across the world. He was completely unaware of your mother’s pregnancy.  84.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: That’s impossible. I met a man who said he was hired by my father to find me. This is news to Boyer.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Who? What man? What was his name?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: He didn’t tell me his name.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Well, what did he look like? When was this? Nathan stands up, angry.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: You gave me away to strangers.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Tell me who this man was.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: You pulled the surveillance. Left me for dead! Boyer stands up, too.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: I gave you a name and a life! And when your mother died, I appointed you a new set of parents, a new home, and an unblemished existence. I know every grade you ever received, every girl you ever kissed, and every nightmare that haunts you in your sleep. (beat) I know everything there is to know about you, Nathan, so please give me the courtesy of sitting back down while we sort this situation out. Nathan sits back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kozlow and Becker sit in the same house as before, in the dark. They sit in silence. Finally, a car PULLS up across the street. It parks in th driveway next to Nathan’s house -- Karen’s house.  85. Two CIA AGENTS get out of the car, followed by Karen. Kozlow and Becker look at each other. This is who they’ve been waiting for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The private plane LANDS on an airstrip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Boyer isn’t paying attention, Nathan looks through of the notes that he found on the Stranger. Most of them written in Ukrainian. Some key words are in English. As he scans through some of the notes, one passage pops o at him.. An American phone number is listed. Nathan looks over at a bulky aircraft phone right next to bathroom. He looks over at Boyer, who is on his laptop.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I’m going to the bathroom. Boyer nods, barely paying attention. Nathan gets up to use the bathroom, but picks up the airc phone instead. DIALS the Stranger’s listed number. Once the phone starts RINGING, he hears another cell phon RINGING at the front of the plane... It's Tom Shealy's cell phone. Shealy picks up.

dialogues.speaker: SHEALY
dialogues.text: Hello? Shealy’s voice ECHOES inside Nathan’s phone.

dialogues.speaker: SHEALY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello?... Hello? Nathan looks up at Tom Shealy. He turns pale -- HANGS up phone quickly. He thinks for a second. Finally, he picks the phone back up, and stretches its co across the aisle, hooking it into the back leg of a seat. Boyer looks at his watch -- looks out the window at the runway.  86. He checks to see if Nathan is back in his seat -- not yet Suddenly, he hears the ALARM go off at the back of the pl Boyer gets up and runs to the back, but trips over the ph cord, on his way. Agent 1 follows Boyer to the back door, see what’s going on... BOYER’S POV: The Emergency Exit has been opened, with the raft laid out. Nathan is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan runs for his life across the runway, as the sun ri The nearest building in the small, barren airport, is a o story Control Tower. He sees a Control Tower in the distance, and heads for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyer gets out his cell.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: He’s escaped! But as soon as Boyer turns around, he realizes Tom Shealy holding a gun on him. Boyer is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: TOM SHEALY
dialogues.text: It’s nothing personal Frank. All Kozlow wants is the kid. He has no intention of harming anyone. AGENT 1 comes from behind Boyer, and handcuffs him.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Why, Tom? Why?

dialogues.speaker: TOM SHEALY
dialogues.text: You know why, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as Nathan enters the tower, he sees two AIR TRAFF CONTROLLERS standing inside. When they turn around, he realizes, they’re not Air Traffic Controllers at all... It’s Victor Kozlow and his partner, Becker.  87.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: Hello, young man. With nowhere to run, Nathan slowly walks backwards out of Tower, back on to the runway.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s nowhere to go, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan sees Boyer, being held by Agent 1, and Tom Shealy, waiting for him outside. Nathan is trapped, as Becker comes from behind him, and p a strangle hold on him. Kozlow slowly exits the Tower, and takes a good look at Boyer.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: You're not aging well, Frank. Been under some stress? Boyer looks at Shealy, in disbelief. Then to Kozlow:

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Take me, for god’s sake. I’m Martin’s only contact. Kozlow LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: It runs a lot deeper than that, Frank. Doesn’t it? Nathan tries to get free, but Becker tightens his hold.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell Nathan... the truth about Martin Spade.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: He’s an emissary for the United States of-

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: He broke the fourth Geneva convention, Frank. Killed civilians... women, children.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: It was an accident, and you know it.  88.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: Tell Nathan the name of the child Martin murdered, years ago.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: I was an accident-

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: Tell him the name of the child. Agent 1 pushes the gun up against Boyer’s neck. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Kozlow... Peter Kozlow.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: My son... On his eleventh birthday. Nathan realizes the kind of danger he’s in. But he’s helpless.

dialogues.speaker: TOM SHEALY
dialogues.text: (to Boyer) (softly) How many people have to die, for us to save this one kid, Frank? All we have to do, is give him the kid, and he goes away. It’s for the best.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: All those years... Tom. All those years... we were friends.

dialogues.speaker: TOM SHEALY
dialogues.text: It’s just a simple trade, Frank. No more, no less. Tom places a chloroform rag in Boyer’s mouth, causing him be sedated. Becker injects a syringe into Nathan’s neck, causing him pass out, as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan slowly wakes up, tied to a chair, inside a hotel r He has a rag in his mouth, causing him to BREATHE loudly through his nose. He drearily looks around, and sees that Victor Kozlow is sitting across from him... and Karen is up in a chair next to him -- rag in mouth, as well.  89. Kozlow motions for Becker to take the rag out of Nathan’s mouth. Nathan stares at Kozlow intently, while Becker takes it o Kozlow smiles.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: At last we meet.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Why is she here?

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: Because she means something to you.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Let her go. I don’t care what you do to me... just let her go.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: Thank you for further proving my point. Nathan looks around the room. He sees the Canadian Nation Tower (CN Tower) outside the large window. It’s a beautif structure, with a big, gorgeous blue sky surrounding it. Something about this room is familiar.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Astonishing view, isn’t it? I thought it would be serendipitous to bring you here, before we take you back to Odessa.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I don’t get it.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: This is the room where your mother took her last breath. Nathan immediately knows he’s right. His anger begins to swell inside him.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: You killed her...

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: That’s not true, Nathan. I had no intention of killing your mother.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Bullshit.  90.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: Well, you should know better than anyone... you were in the room when it happened. Nathan takes pause.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: You don’t remember, do you?

dialogues.speaker: QUICK FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: - The CN Tower - The Suitcase on the bed BACK TO. Kozlow.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s a funny thing, the human mind. I’ve outsmarted some of the world’s finest leaders. Covered my tracks meticulously, systematically and with great caution over the years. I take great pride in my attention to detail. But in this hotel room, I made one tiny, colossal mistake... (beat) I forgot to check under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (thinking) The bed?...

dialogues.speaker: QUICK FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Nathan's mother, Lorna, years earlier, is GASPING for air while Kozlow kneels over her.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ..-What you're feeling right now, is your nervous system deteriorating. If you answer my question correctly, you can keep the mask. If not, I will keep the mask. Do you understand? As Nathan's mother nods, we see... NATHAN, three years old, hiding under the bed, GASPING fo air, witnessing the whole thing.  gl. Kozlow places the mask back on Lorna.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Now, I'll ask you one more time...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: And in that one time... you'll get the same answer. Lorna RIPS the mask off, and tosses it under the bed... .--to young Nathan, who immediately puts it on.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Kozlow:

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: I’m not a monster, Nathan. It’s not my style to kill a lowly CIA analyst. But, she sacrificed her life, so that you could live yours...

dialogues.speaker: QUICK FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Nathan, under the bed with the mask on, watches his mothe take her last breath... He's terrified. He watches Kozlow and Becker's feet, as they exit the roo The sirens from below get LOUDER. He looks at his mother. she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Kozlow.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I left the room with a gray folder, when I could've had the crown jewel. Kozlow throws up his arms.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'est la vie. Better late than never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amidst the big, beautiful sky, we see the end of a sniper rifle peek out behind the tip of the Tower. SCOPE POV: The hotel room -- with Nathan, Karen, Kozlow, Becker. Tom Shealy, and Agent 1. 1500 yards away.  92. Kozlow is obscured by Nathan and Karen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kozlow adjusts his seat to be closer to Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: Martin, at his core, is an evil soul, Nathan. He has no moral code. Well, I’m going to take a page from his notebook. I’m going to let it be known that I have Martin Spade’s son... And when he comes to get you, which I know he will... he’s going to find you cut up in to a thousand pieces... starting with your ears... Kozlow touches Nathan’s ear. Nathan pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then your eyes... Suddenly, three bullets PEARCE through the window, HITTIN Agent 1 in the head and chest. He drops to the floor instantaneously. Everyone else spreads in different directions -- hiding behind walls. Kozlow, Becker and Tom Shealy get out their guns. Silence... as a pool of blood develops under Agent 1’s he Nathan and Karen are right in the middle of the room in f view. Karen is CRYING. Everyone looks out the window to see where the bullets ca from. As Tom peeks out from behind the wall, he gets SHOT throu his right eye. Blood SPLATTERS, as he drops to the ground with a THUD.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in Ukrainian) Where is he!? Becker takes a small mirror to get a look out the window. The reflection shows a MAN IN BLACK, way off in the dista on the top of the CN Tower. The mirror gets SHOT, and SHATTERS into a hundred fragmen  93. Nathan sees Karen crying -- tries to pull free from the r It dawns on him...

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (whispers ) We're out in the open... but he’s not shooting at us. Karen nods in confirmation. Becker loads a semi-automatic.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: (in Ukrainian) He’s on the top of the CN Tower, yes? Becker nods.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (under his breath) CN Tower... Suddenly, two bullets PEARCE though the rope that ties Na to the chair. Two more PEARCE through Karen’s rope. Before Kozlow realizes they’re free:

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Karen)

dialogues.speaker: RUN
dialogues.text: Nathan and Karen run out the door, as Kozlow SHOOTS at th Becker takes his semi-automatic and aims it at the ceilin He FIRES off a round, causing the ceiling to obstruct the SNIPER’S view and the SPRINKLERS and ALARM to go off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan and Karen run down the hallway, as Becker exits th room, chasing them, SHOOTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan and Karen run out of the lobby, into the streets, toward the CN Tower. Becker chases them through the streets, SHOOTING his guns causing cars to CRASH and people to SCREAM and hide in ev direction.  94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan and Karen enter the CN Tower lobby -- Nathan JAMS chair inside the revolving door.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Hey! Hold it right there- The glass gets SHOT out by Becker, causing TOURISTS to ru and SCREAM and scatter in every direction. BAM! BAM! BAM! Nathan and Karen run to one of the elevators, as SECURITY GUARDS get wiped out, one by one, by Becker. Nathan JABS away at the elevator buttons, hoping the door will close before Becker gets to them. Becker runs towards the elevator, SHOOTING at the back wa Finally, when the doors slowly close, Becker’s hand reach in between the doors. Karen takes the emergency phone and HAMMERS at his finger until he lets go -- the doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator has a glass floor panel. As the elevator ris Becker SHOOTS out the glass, causing Nathan and Karen to to cling tight to the side wall... “What a Difference a Day Makes” plays over the elevator speakers, as Karen and Nathan wait to get to the top.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (calmly) You've got to get everyone into the stairwell. Karen nods. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Is that the best you’ve got?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (beat) Yup.

dialogues.speaker: BING.
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open to the higher Sky Pod, an observa deck over 1,400 feet above the ground. The view is breathtaking -- overseeing 70 miles of land, city and oce  95. TOURISTS are everywhere, and Becker is most assuredly on next elevator to arrive. Nathan runs to a TICKET TAKER.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: You’ve got to stop the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: TICKET TAKER
dialogues.text: Okay, just calm down-

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: You’ve got to stop the elevator!! Karen runs to random PEOPLE, URGING them to get off the d immediately. Two GUARDS notice Nathan and Karen causing panic.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD 1
dialogues.text: Hey! Where are your tickets?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: There’s no time! Everyone has to evacuate the deck. Guard 2 takes out a tazer and aims it at Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD 2
dialogues.text: I’m going to ask you to step back, sir. The next elevator arrives. DING. Nathan gets behind the Guard. The elevator opens, revealing Becker with his Semi-automa He starts SHOOTING up the place -- beginning with the Gua Nathan shields himself with the Guard, as TOURISTS and PATRONS SCREAM and run for their lives. Becker has gone completely mad, BLOWING out half the wind as people duck for cover. A harsh WIND comes in from the outside, SUCKING some people over the ledge. Nathan pulls the gun from the dead Guard’s holster, but Becker runs at him, strong. Nathan starts running towards the ledge, as Becker SHOOTS him. Nathan slips and falls over the edge, catching the floor railing. His gun slides over to Karen. Nathan dangles off the side of the Space Deck, watching another FEMALE TOURIST lose her grasp and fall to her dea  96. The plunge to death is so far below that her SCREAMS fade into silence. Nathan tries to maintain a grip, as Becker slowly walks t the edge, and stands over him. Becker slowly GRINDS his shoe into Nathan’s right hand, causing it to let go. He starts grinding on Nathan’s othe hand. Nathan winces in agony, as he prepares to let go and fall 1400 feet. Suddenly, two SHOTS hit Becker in the back... He slowly falls towards Nathan, passing over him, and plunging to h death. NATHAN’S POV: A hand with a black glove extends over the ledge... Nathan grabs the hand as the SNIPER, dressed head to toe black, helps him up to safety. When Nathan fully stands up, he looks eye-to-eye at the Sniper, whose face is obscured by a black mask... Is this his father? They look at each other for a moment, before the Sniper o his mouth to say something.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: December 18th, 1994. Your mother was going to meet me here, at the tower... to introduce me to you... Long pause. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But, she never showed up. Suddenly, the Sniper gets SHOT in the side of his neck. A then SHOT in the ribs, causing him to fall off the ledge.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Nooooo0!!! The Sniper barely CATCHES the floor railing. He dangles o the ledge, wounded. Kozlow, holding the smoking gun, takes aim at Nathan... But Kozlow gets SHOT in the chest, before he can pull off another shot. REVEAL: Karen, holding the Guard’s gun, trembling.  97. Nathan grabs another gun off the floor, and SHOOTS Kozlow multiple times, making sure he’s dead for good. Kozlow drops his gun, and falls to the ground, COUGHING u blood. As Nathan gets closer to him, he realizes Kozlow has a bu proof jacket on. He’s alive, but in bad shape. Nathan holds his sights on Kozlow.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW
dialogues.text: Do it... aim the gun at my head and pull the trigger. Do what father knows best... Karen walks to the ledge where the Sniper fell. Nathan looks at her -- she shakes her head, ‘he’s gone’.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, the CIA... is your father. New life, new name, new home... (looks at Karen) New girl... You’1ll be owned by them... forever. Nathan takes aim at Kozlow’s head -- the anger swelling inside him.

dialogues.speaker: KOZLOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (coughs more blood) Please, Nathan... put me out of my misery. Let me be... with my son... Nathan takes pause. This statement has a profound impact him. He begins lowering his weapon. He looks at the elevators -- two of them will arrive in less than a minut Nathan grabs a Guards’ handcuffs and puts them on Kozlow.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I need to be on my own.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Nathan finishes putting on the handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: He’s right. I need to find myself, before they define who I am.  98.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: But, you don’t have any money, any-

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I'll get by. Find my way. The elevators are about to open.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just want you to know that... They look at each other, as Nathan tries to find the word Finally, Karen KISSES him -- a sweet kiss, cut off short DING. The elevator opens, and numerous TORONTO POLICE OFFICERS OFFICIALS storm out, on to the deck. But only Karen is in their sights when they arrive.

dialogues.speaker: TORONTO POLICE
dialogues.text: (to Karen) Put your hands up! The POLICE gather other TOURISTS and VICTIMS, who were ta cover. - They arrest Kozlow - They escort Karen off the floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOW MOTION: As the TOURISTS and PATRONS are led out of t building... Nathan is among them, blending right in, hanging his head low, so as not to be noticed amidst the chaos. When he ge out in a courtyard, to safety, he looks up at the tall to One last look... and then disappears into an alleyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phones RINGING off the hook. It’s a mad house. Frank Boyer paces around the conference room, while multi AGENTS answer the phones and TALK to various SOURCES. He looks agitated, wanting answers. A YOUNG AGENT approaches him.  99.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG AGENT
dialogues.text: We have more information about Shealy-

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: I don’t care about Shealy. Where’s Nathan Harper? Another AGENT hangs up his phone.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER AGENT
dialogues.text: No sign of Harper or the Sniper, sir. Boyer looks at his assistant, LANCE.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Spade?

dialogues.speaker: LANCE
dialogues.text: No word, yet. Boyer hangs his head in frustration. INT. WESLEY’S OFFICE -- DAY Wesley sits at his desk, paying off a large outstanding b on his mortgage. Fletcher walks in, as Wesley quickly hides the document.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: (hands him the note) This just came in for you. Wesley opens the note, as Fletcher leaves. It reads: Love the quilt. Isn’t it a little crooked? Wesley looks up at his wife’s quilt, hanging up on the wa It's definitely a little off kilter. He gets up and walks over to it. But just before he adjus it, he notices a tiny hole punctured in the middle. He ta the quilt off the wall to see what’s behind it... It’s a small spy camera, looking right at him. Wesley grabs the camera, and immediately RIPS it off the attached wires.  100. EXT. DEPUTY’S OFFICE -- LATER Wesley, some OFFICERS, and a TECH GUY stand outside the Precinct. The Tech Guy CRACKS open a pipe attached to the brick wall, and sees some strange wires.

dialogues.speaker: TECH GUY
dialogues.text: Looks like someone hacked in through the phone lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LAB TECHNICIAN comes up with a trace from the newly—fou wires.

dialogues.speaker: LAB TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: We got an address. Kilton Hotel, Room 512, two blocks away. 1414 South Christopher Street- Wesley and his DEPUTIES run out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wesley and numerous DEPUTIES approach Room 512 with their guns out. Wesley KNOCKS on the door. No answer.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: Open up! Police! No response. Wesley nods for a DEPUTY to slide a key card to unlock th door. Once the door UNLOCKS, they BARGE into the room, wi their weapons out... but no one is inside. They see multiple running television monitors with surveillance video -- every room of the Precinct was bein watched. There is wiretap equipment, placed on the bed with memo n attached, reading: Upstairs bedroom, kitchen, Living room Wesley looks closer at one of the surveillance monitors.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My house... Fletcher realizes the memo notes are for Wesley.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: All your phones, sir...  101. Wesley starts to realize he’s in a world of shit. A DVD Player rests on a table top. A small memo note read Play me! Wesley presses PLAY. Footage appears on the screen of Jack Shapiro, when he wa Wesley’s office the day before. It starts from when Jack Marcus are on their way out the door:

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (on TV) Personally, I’d be most worried about the cameras.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: (on TV) Why’s that?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (on TV) Because there’s always someone behind them.... Someone who knows more than you. The screen goes to black. Wesley GULPS, as Fletcher receives a note from a fellow OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Sir, the Marshal’s office claims they never heard of a ‘Jack Shapiro’ over there. They don’t even have an arson expert. Another DEPUTY plays a tape-recorder on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...you should know that the CIA came to me today. They found him in Booneville, Kentucky. I can give you a heads up with any information they give me, if you want—

dialogues.speaker: STRANGE VOICE
dialogues.text: We won’t be needing you any- Wesley quickly presses STOP on the recorder. Suddenly, a gun is aimed at Wesley... Three FBI AGENTS ar in the room.  102.

dialogues.speaker: FBI AGENT
dialogues.text: Wesley Carr? Wesley looks at them, dumbfounded. They take out their badges. FBI AGENT (CONT’D) We're federal agents, and you’re under arrest for conspiracy of treason as well as tampering with an ongoing investigation... INT. FRANK BOYER’S OFFICE -- NIGHT Boyer is on his cell phone, pacing around his office.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: (phone) I didn’t authorize a sting operation.

dialogues.speaker: FBI AGENT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We got him on at least six federal offences. Boyer’s assistant, Lance, brings Boyer a coffee, and plac it next to a red phone on Boyer’s desk.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: (phone) Let’s get something straight. The CIA takes no responsibility for any surveillance of a Sheriff Wesley Carr.

dialogues.speaker: FBI AGENT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well, somebody did it. And they had this guy tapped every which way from Sunday. Carr keeps mentioning somebody named Jack Shapiro.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: (phone) Never heard of him.

dialogues.speaker: FBI AGENT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Neither has the Marshal’s office. Gotta be one of yours.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: (phone) I'm telling you, I never heard of a Jack Shapiro.  103. Suddenly, Boyer’s red phone RINGS. It’s a very important phone. Boyer looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: FBI AGENT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Gotta be this guy, Jack Shapiro.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: (phone ) Who the hell is JACK SHAPIRO!? The red phone RINGS again. Lance points at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: LANCE
dialogues.text: Sir...? Boyer stares at the red phone. It RINGS again. He slowly closes his cell phone... and walks over to the red phone. Picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: (beat) Boyer.

dialogues.speaker: JACK SHAPIRO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello, Frank...

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: (phone) Martin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Shapiro, on a headset, with his shirt off, is calmly stitching up a wound in his neck -- the wound he got savi Nathan's life. He's Martin Spade. INTERCUT: Boyer/Martin conversation.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: I found him, Frank. You did a good job hiding him. But I found him.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: He’s umm... perfectly safe now, Martin.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: That’s not what I hear.  104.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: You're supposed to be off the grid right now. The fact that you’re making this call, tells me your letting personal feelings compromise the job at hand.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: I’m in the field... where I belong. And you're sitting behind a desk... where you belong. Martin puts on a tuxedo shirt and starts buttoning it up. hides his stitches with the shirt collar.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: Still, the nature of this call, puts into question your ability to perform your job. If I find out that you make contact with Nathan again, I'll be forced to recommend pulling you out of the field... indefinitely.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Save the empty threats, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: They’re the only threats I’ve got.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Fair enough. I promise to hold up my end of the bargain, as long as you hold up yours.

dialogues.speaker: BOYER
dialogues.text: We'll do everything in our power to find him, and protect him, Martin. You have my word. Martin puts on a bow tie.

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Good. Because if I find out his life’s in danger again. Or if anything should happen to him. You won't be sitting behind a desk anymore, Frank. You’1ll be lying in an open casket. Martin HANGS up.

dialogues.speaker: STAY WITH MARTIN
dialogues.text: Martin adjusts his bow tie, and puts on a sharp tuxedo jacket. He grabs a tiny handgun off the sink, and places in his inside pocket. He it  105. He exits the bathroom into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweeping MUSIC fills the air. It’s the “BLUE DENUBE WALTZ by Strauss. Hundreds of GUESTS in tuxedos and evening gowns are danci CHATTING, eating and drinking. A BEAUTIFUL WOMAN approaches Martin. She reaches her hand out for a dance.

dialogues.speaker: BEAUTIFUL WOMAN
dialogues.text: Are you ready, darling?

dialogues.speaker: MARTIN
dialogues.text: Of course, my dear. They immediately sweep into the dance floor, dancing to t MUSIC. Martin is an excellent dancer, and he has this wom in the palm of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An open desert landscape, with WIND blowing hard in all directions. As tumbleweeds FLOAT by... an old, run down cabin stands alone. The chimes on the porch JINGLE in the wind. Old Buddha sculptures and African art decorate the cabin. The outside walls are filled with Aboriginal face masks and Indian feathers. Nathan stands a few yards from the cabin, looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan approaches the front door, and KNOCKS. After a moment, a MAN opens the door... It's Marcus Lang. (Jack Shapiro's arson partner from earl He looks at Nathan, for a moment, but doesn’t speak. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Are you Paul Rasmus?  106. Marcus nods.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: RASMUS
dialogues.text: (British accent) No.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: You were supposed to meet me, a couple day ago. On an overnight train from Virginia?

dialogues.speaker: RASMUS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I think you have me mixed up with someone else. Rasmus tries to shut the door. Nathan holds it open.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: Well, is there another Paul Rasmus in Modesto? It’s important.

dialogues.speaker: RASMUS
dialogues.text: I really couldn’t tell you. I don’t know. Nathan looks defeated -- out of options.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: I’m... looking for information about my father. If you know anything-

dialogues.speaker: RASMUS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I wish I could help. Rasmus tries shutting the door, again. Nathan holds it open, again.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN
dialogues.text: (desperate) Please... As Nathan holds the door, he sees Rasmus’s WIFE and three CHILDREN inside, sitting at the dinner table. They look b at him, wondering what’s going on. Nathan has clearly interrupted a family supper. He feels -- lets go of the door.

dialogues.speaker: NATHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry to have bothered you.  107. Nathan walks away towards the road. INT. RASMUS’S KITCHEN -- MOMENTS LATER Rasmus sits down at the table to continue eating his dinn

dialogues.speaker: WIFE
dialogues.text: Who was that, hun?

dialogues.speaker: RASMUS
dialogues.text: Someone with the wrong address. Rasmus’s wife nods and starts making funny faces at their SON, 6, who returns the gesture. They’re the cutest famil in the world. CLOSE ON: Rasmus, looking at his beautiful family -- conflicted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan waits, by himself, at a lonely bus stop in the mid of the desert. The wind still BLOWS heavily, as Nathan watches the sun go down. Where to go from here? He takes out the picture of his mother that Boyer gave hi He feels more lost and lonely than ever. In the distance, an old Volkswagon beetle comes into view driving towards the Stop. The beetle PULLS up, in front o Nathan... It’s Rasmus. He doesn’t look at Nathan -- looks straight ahead, thinking. The ENGINE stays on. Nathan gets up, and approaches the passenger side window. After a long moment... Rasmus turns and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: RASMUS
dialogues.text: Get in.
